22.11: And the Priest, when he will buy a person, he who is bought with his money will eat of his bread, and those born in his house, those shall eat of his bread.
22.12: And the daughter of the Priest, when she will belong to a man who is a foreigner, also she shall not eat from an offering of holiness.
22.13: And the daughter of the Priest, when she will be a widow or divorced, and she has no children, she shall return to the house of her father as during her virginity; she shall eat of the bread of her father and no foreigner shall eat of it.
22.14: And a man who will eat the holy thing forgetfully will add one fifth to it and will give the holy thing to the Priest.
22.15: And the children of Israel shall not pollute the holy things that they offer to LORD JEHOVAH;
22.16: And they shall take upon them evil and sins when they eat of their holy things, because I AM LORD JEHOVAH who hallows them.’”
22.17: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
22.18: “Speak with Ahron and with his children and with all of the children of Israel and say to them: ‘A man of the house of Israel or of those who are turned to me who dwell in Israel, who will offer his offering of all their vows and of all their offerings that they bring to LORD JEHOVAH;
22.19: A burnt peace offering is acceptable: a male that has no defect in it, of oxen or of lambs or of goats.
22.20: You shall offer none that has a flaw in it because it is not desirable to you.
22.21: And a man who will offer a peace sacrifice to LORD JEHOVAH to dedicate a vow or a dedication of oxen or of goats, when it has no defect in it, shall be accepted, if there is no defect in it.
22.22: What is blind or what is broken, or what is mangy, or what is feeble, or what is leprous, or what is hairless, you shall not bring one of these to LORD JEHOVAH, and you shall not place an offering of such things on the altar for LORD JEHOVAH.
22.23: And a bull, or lamb which has been notched in its ear, or a male fattail you may make an offering, however it shall not be accepted for a vow.
22.24: And what is bruised, or what is castrated, or what is mutilated you shall not bring to LORD JEHOVAH and you shall not serve in your land.
22.25: And you shall not bring the bread of your God from the hand of the son of a foreigner, of any of these, because they are corrupt and a defect is in them; they are not accepted from you.'"
22.26: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
22.27: “A bullock, or lamb, or a kid, when it will be born, shall be following its mother seven days, and from the eighth day and beyond his offering shall be accepted as an offering to LORD JEHOVAH.
22.28: And a bullock or a sheep itself and its son you shall not slaughter on one day.
22.29: And if you will sacrifice a sacrifice of thanksgiving to LORD JEHOVAH, sacrifice it acceptably.
22.30: And in that day it shall be eaten, and you shall not leave any of it to the morning; I AM LORD JEHOVAH.
22.31: Keep my commands and do them; I AM LORD JEHOVAH.
22.32: And you shall not pollute the Name of my holiness which is hallowed among the children of Israel; I AM LORD JEHOVAH who hallows you.
22.33: For I brought you out from the land of Egypt to be God to you; I AM LORD JEHOVAH."

23.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
23.2: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them: ‘The feasts of LORD JEHOVAH which you will announce are called and holy; these are my feasts.
23.3: Six days you shall do work and the seventh day is the Sabbath, and you shall be tranquil holiness to LORD JEHOVAH and you shall do no work; it is the Sabbath to LORD JEHOVAH in every house of your dwellings.
23.4: These are the feast days of LORD JEHOVAH; you shall announce them as called and holy in their times.
23.5: In the first month in the fourteenth in the month, between evenings, is Passover to LORD JEHOVAH.
23.6: And on the fifteenth in the same month is the feast of unleavened bread to LORD JEHOVAH; seven days you shall eat unleavened bread.
23.7: The first day is announced and shall be holy to you and you shall do no work of labor.
23.8: And bring gifts to LORD JEHOVAH seven days, and the seventh day shall be announced and holy, and you shall do no work of labor.'"
23.9: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
23.10: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them: ‘Whenever you shall enter to the land that I give to you and you have harvested its harvest, bring a sheaf of the first fruits of your harvest to the Priest:
23.11: And you shall dedicate the sheaf before LORD JEHOVAH to be acceptable, and after another day the Priest shall dedicate it.
23.12: And you shall offer a male lamb a year old that has no defect in it, in the day that you dedicate the sheaf, as a burnt peace offering to LORD JEHOVAH.
23.13: And its offering is two tenths of two threegallon measures fine flour that is sprinkled with oil, a gift to LORD JEHOVAH for a sweet savor, and its drink offering, a fourth of a hin of wine.
23.14: And the bread and parched corn and new corn you shall not eat until this day, until the day that you bring a gift to your God: the Written Law to eternity for your generations in every house of your dwellings.
23.15: And count to yourselves after the day that you bring a sheaf of the dedication: seven weeks shall be complete:
23.16: Unto after the seventh week, count fifty days, and bring a meal offering from The New to LORD JEHOVAH.
23.17: From among your dwellings bring the bread of the offering; let them be two loaves of two tenths of fine flour and leaven; they shall be baked first fruits to LORD JEHOVAH.
23.18: And bring with the bread seven lambs, offspring of a year that have no defect in them, and one bullock, son of an oxen, and two rams; they shall be burnt peace offerings to LORD JEHOVAH and their meal offerings and their drink offerings, gifts for a sweet savor to LORD JEHOVAH.
23.19: And offer one kid of goats for the sake of sin and two lambs, offspring of one year old for a peace sacrifice.
23.20: And the Priest shall dedicate them with the bread of first fruits, an offering before LORD JEHOVAH with two lambs; they shall be holy before LORD JEHOVAH for the Priest.
23.21: And announce this day “Called and holy”, and you shall do no work of labor: the Written Law to eternity for your generations in every house of your dwelling.
23.22: And when you harvest the harvest of your land, you shall not finish the edges of your fields in your harvest and you shall not glean the gleaning of your harvest, but leave them for the poor and for those who are converted to me; I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God.'"
23.23: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
23.24: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them: ‘On day one in the seventh month, rest, and the memorial of a proclamation shall be made to you; it shall be announced and holy to you.
23.25: And you shall do no work of labor and bring offerings to LORD JEHOVAH.'"
23.26: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him,
23.27: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them: ‘In the tenth of this seventh month is the day of atonement; it shall be proclaimed and holy to you, and humble your souls and bring gifts to LORD JEHOVAH.
23.28: And you shall do no work in this day, because it is the day of atonement to atone for you before LORD JEHOVAH your God.
23.29: Because every soul that will not be humbled in this day will be destroyed from his people.
23.30: And every soul who will do any work in this day I shall destroy that soul from among his people.
23.31: And you shall do no work: the Written Law to eternity for your generations in every house of your dwelling.
23.32: It is a Sabbath rest to you, and humble your souls in the ninth of the month in the evening; between evenings, from evening and unto evening, rest your Sabbaths.'"
23.33: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him,
23.34: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them: ‘In the fifteenth of this, the seventh month, make a feast of tabernacles seven days before LORD JEHOVAH.
23.35: The first day shall be proclaimed and holy to you and you shall do no work of labor.
23.36: And bring gifts to LORD JEHOVAH for seven days, and the eighth day shall be proclaimed and holy to you, and bring gifts to LORD JEHOVAH and be assembled and you shall do no work of labor.
23.37: These are the feast days of LORD JEHOVAH, so that you shall proclaim them announced and holy, and you shall bring gifts in them to LORD JEHOVAH: burnt peace offerings and fine wheat flour and drink offerings and sacrifices; it is right day by day:
23.38: Apart from the Sabbaths of LORD JEHOVAH and apart from your offerings and apart from your gifts and apart from all of your vows and apart from all your offerings that you are giving to LORD JEHOVAH.
23.39: However, in fifteenth of the seventh month, whenever you gather crops of the land, make a feast to LORD JEHOVAH seven days: in the first day, suspension of labor, and in the eighth day, rest.
23.40: Take to you in the first day the fruit of beautiful orange trees and the hearts of palm trees and myrtle and willow, and rejoice before LORD JEHOVAH your God seven days, all of the house of Israel.
23.41: And make this festival to LORD JEHOVAH seven days in a year: the Written Law to eternity for your generations; make it in the seventh month.
23.42: Dwell in huts seven days; all of the house of Israel will dwell in huts:
23.43: That your generations may know that I made the children of Israel to dwell in huts when I brought them out from the land of Egypt; I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God."
23.44: And Moshe told the children of Israel the festivals of LORD JEHOVAH.'"

24.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
24.2: “Command the children of Israel and they shall bring to you pure pressed oil of olives to light the lamps constantly.
24.3: Outside of the face of the door of the Testimony in the Time Tabernacle, and Ahron shall be arranging them from evening and until morning before LORD JEHOVAH continually, the Law to eternity for your generations.
24.4: Upon the great menorah he shall be arranging the lamps before LORD JEHOVAH continually.
24.5: And take fine flour and bake twelve cakes of two tenths of an ephah for one cake.
24.6: And he shall arrange them in two rows, six in each row on the pure table before LORD JEHOVAH.
24.7: And put pure frankincense on a row before LORD JEHOVAH and it will be with the bread of memorial and an offering to LORD JEHOVAH.
24.8: In the sixth day Ahron shall be arranging them before LORD JEHOVAH constantly from the presence of the children of Israel, a covenant for eternity.
24.9: It shall be for Ahron and his children and they shall eat it in the holy place because it is to him a Holy of Holy things from the offerings of LORD JEHOVAH; the Written Law to eternity.
24.10: And the son of an Israelite woman went out and he was the son of a man who was an Egyptian among the children of Israel, and the son of the Israelite woman and an Israelite man fought in the camp;
24.11: And the son of the Israelite woman execrated the Name, and he cursed, and they brought him to Moshe, and the name of his mother was Shlomeeth, daughter of Debri, from the tribe of Dan.
24.12: And they imprisoned him in a holding house that something would be declared to them from the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH."
24.13: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
24.14: “Lead him who cursed outside of the camp and everyone who heard it will place their hands on his head and all of the assembly shall stone him.
24.15: And speak with the children of Israel and say to them: 'When a man will revile his God, he shall bear his sin.
24.16: And who ever will execrate the Name of LORD JEHOVAH surely shall be killed and surely all of the assembly shall stone him; he who is converted to me or a son of Israel, when he has execrated my Name, he shall be killed.
24.17: And if a man will kill any person of mankind, he shall surely be killed.
24.18: And he who will kill the life of a domestic animal, he shall pay life in the place of life.
24.19: And if a man shall cause a blemish to his fellow, according to the blemish that he caused to his fellow, thus it shall be done to him;
24.20: Breaking in place of breaking, an eye in place of an eye, a tooth in the place of a tooth; just as he causes a flaw to his fellow, thus it shall be done to him.
24.21: And he who will kill a domestic animal shall pay it, and he who will kill a person shall be killed.
24.22: One judgment shall be for you and for those who are converted to me, and for a son of Israel it shall be so; I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God.’”
24.23: And Moshe spoke to the children of Israel and they brought out him who cursed outside of the camp and they stoned him with stones and he died, and the children of Israel did as LORD JEHOVAH had commanded Moshe.

25.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe in the mountain of Sinai and said to him:
25.2: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them: “Whenever you have entered the land that I give to you as an inheritance, the land shall rest for a Sabbath to LORD JEHOVAH.
25.3: Six years you shall sow your fields and six years you shall prune your vineyards and six years you shall be gathering your produce;
25.4: And the seventh year shall be a Sabbath rest to the land and there shall be to you a Sabbath for LORD JEHOVAH; you shall not sow your fields and you shall not prune your vineyards.
25.5: And you shall not harvest what grows of your harvest and you shall not gather the grapes of your vine shoots; the land will have a year of Sabbath.
25.6: And you shall have a Sabbath of the land for food, for you and for your servants and for your maids and for your hired men and for your squatters who dwell with you,
25.7: And for your domestic animals and for the beasts that are in your land; you will have all the crops for food.
25.8: And count to yourselves seven years of Sabbaths, seven years by seven times, and they shall be for you the days of seven Sabbaths of years forty and nine years.
25.9: And sound with the trumpet sound on the trumpet on the tenth in the seventh month; on the day of atonement sound a trumpet in all your land.
25.10: And hallow the fiftieth year of years and call for freedom in the land for all its inhabitants and it shall be a restoration to you, and return each man to his inheritance and each man to his family.
25.11: And in the fiftieth year of years you shall have a restoration; you shall not sow your land and you shall not harvest its natural crop and you shall not pick its vine shoots.
25.12: Because it is a restoration, and holiness shall be upon you, and eat the crops from the field.
25.13: In this year of restoration also return a man to his inheritance.
25.14: And if you sell goods to your neighbor, or if you buy from your neighbor, you shall not cheat any man his brother:
25.15: By the number of years after the restoration, buy from your neighbor, and by the number of years of a crop he shall sell to you:
25.16: In proportion to the multitude of years, you shall increase its price, and in proportion to the fewness of years you shall decrease its price, because he sells to you by that number of crop years.
25.17: And you shall not cheat any man his brother, and be in awe of your God, because I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God.
25.18: Do my commands and keep my judgments and do them, and dwell in the land in quietness.
25.19: And the land shall give its fruit and you shall eat and you shall be satisfied and you shall dwell in it in quietness.
25.20: And if you say, 'What will we eat in the seventh year when we do not sow and we do not gather its harvests?':
25.21: I shall send you my blessings in the sixth year and it will produce the crops of three years.
25.22: And you shall sow in the eighth year and you shall eat of old crops until the ninth year; until the crop comes in, be eating the old.
25.23: And the land in truth shall not be sold for eternity, because the land is mine and you are inhabitants and pilgrims with me.
25.24: And in all the land of your inheritance you shall give a redemption of the land.
25.25: And if your brother will become poor and will sell some of his inheritance, his close one that is close to him will come redeem the sale of his brother.
25.26: And if there is not one who redeems, and it will come into his hand and he will find enough for his redemption;
25.27: He will account the years of his purchase and he shall return the surplus to the man who bought from him and will return his inheritance.
25.28: And if it does not come into his hands so as to pay him, the purchase shall be firm to him who bought it until the year of restoration, and he shall go forth in the restoration and he shall return to his inheritance.
25.29: And if a man will sell a house, a dwelling of a city that has a wall, it shall be his redemption until the year of his sale is finished; his redemption shall be from that time to the time.
25.30: And if it is not redeemed until the entire year is finished for him, the house that is in the city that has a wall shall be established in truth to him who bought it, and it will be for his generations and it will not depart from him in the restoration.
25.31: But the houses of the country without a wall surrounding them as a field of the land, they shall be considered redemption; it shall be theirs, and in the restoration they will come forth.
25.32: And the towns of Levites, the houses that are in the town of their inheritance, shall be the redemption to eternity for the Levites.
25.33: And he who will redeem the purchase of a Levite will bring forth from his purchase of the house and the field of his inheritance in the restoration, because the houses of the cities of Levites, those are their inheritance among the children of Israel.
25.34: And the field that is in the edges of their city shall not be sold because that is a heritage for them to eternity.
25.35: And if your brother will become poor and he will stretch out his hand with you, you may not hold him as a squatter and like a foreigner and he shall live with you.
25.36: Do not take a discount and interest from him, and be in awe of your God, and your brother shall live with you.
25.37: Do not give your silver to him at a discount and do not give your food with interest.
25.38: I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God who brought you out from the land of Egypt, that I shall give to you the land of Canaan, and I shall be God to you.
25.39: And if your brother will become poor and will be sold to you, you shall not force him into the service of a Servant:
25.40: He shall be with you as a hired man and like a pilgrim; he shall be with you until the year of restoration.
25.41: And he will go forth from your presence, he and his children with him, and he shall return to his family, and he shall return to the inheritance of his father.
25.42: Because they are my Servants whom I brought out from the land of Egypt; they shall not be sold with the price of a Servant.
25.43: And you shall not force him into hard service, and be in awe of your God.
25.44: And from your Servants and your Maids who will be yours from the nations that are around you, you shall buy Servants and Maids.
25.45: Also you shall possess some children of foreigners who dwell with you, of them and of their families that are with you who are born in your land, and they shall be an inheritance to you.
25.46: And bequeath them to your children after you to inherit an inheritance and for a lifetime you may make them Laborers; and you shall not compel your brothers, the children of Israel, a man with his brother, to labor hard labor.
25.47: And if there is enough in the hands of an inhabitant and a Pilgrim of your people, and your brother is made poor with him and he will be sold to the inhabitant and to the Pilgrim with you, or to one born of the family of a stranger with you:
25.48: After he will be sold, he shall have redemption; one of his brothers may buy him:
25.49: Or a paternal uncle, or the son of a paternal uncle shall redeem him; one near of his flesh from his tribe shall redeem him, and if he shall have enough in his hands he shall be redeemed.
25.50: He shall count with his buyer from the year when he bought him until the year of restoration, and the money of his sale will be in the number of the years, according to the days of a hired man he shall be with him.
25.51: And if there remain again an abundance of years in proportion to them, he shall return his redemption from the money of his purchase.
25.52: And if a little is left in the years until the year of the restoration, he will account with him, and according to the proportion of his years he shall return his redemption.
25.53: As a hired man, year by year he shall be with him; he shall not force him to labor severely before your eyes.
25.54: And if he will not be redeemed in these things, he will go forth in the year of restoration, he and his children with him.
25.55: Because the children of Israel are my Servants; they are my Servants whom I brought out from the land of Egypt. I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God."

26.1: "You shall not make to yourselves idols, and you shall not erect images or statues for yourselves; you shall not make stones of worship in your land, neither shall you worship them; I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God.
26.2: Keep my commands and reverence my Holy Place; I AM LORD JEHOVAH.
26.3: If you walk in my Law and you keep my commandments and you will do them;
26.4: I shall give your rains in their times and Earth will give its harvests and the tree of the field will give its fruit.
26.5: And you shall thresh the threshing until grape harvest and grape harvest shall overtake sowing seed and you shall eat your bread and you shall be satisfied and you shall dwell in your land in quietness.
26.6: And I shall give peace in your land and you shall lie down and there shall be nothing that frightens you and I shall rid the land of harmful animals and the sword shall not pass through in your land.
26.7: And you shall chase your enemies and they shall fall before you by the sword.
26.8: And five of you shall chase a hundred and a hundred of you shall chase ten thousand and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.
26.9: And I shall turn to you and I shall multiply you and I shall increase you and I shall confirm my covenant with you.
26.10: And you shall eat the old of the old and you shall bring out the old before the new.
26.11: And I shall put my tent among you and my soul shall not detest you.
26.12: And I shall walk among you and I shall be your God and you shall be my people.
26.13: I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God who have brought you out from the land of Egypt that you would not be slaves to them and I have broken the yoke of your bondage and your steps are erect in stature.
26.14: But if you will not listen to me and you will not do all of these commandments;
26.15: If you will reject my Law and your souls will loathe my judgments and you will not do all of my commands and you shall nullify my covenant:
26.16: Also I in this way I shall do to you: I shall order upon you shock and leprosy and scabs and a discharge that destroys the eyes and decays the life and you will sow your seed for nothing and your enemies shall eat it.
26.17: And I shall put my wrath in you and you shall be broken before your enemies and your haters shall rule over you and you shall escape and you shall flee when there is none who chases you.
26.18: And if in these things you will not listen to me again, I shall continue to chastise you each sevenfold for your sins.
26.19: And I shall break the magnificence of your strength and I shall make your skies like iron and your ground like brass:
26.20: And your power shall be spent in futility and your land shall not give its harvests and the trees of the land shall not yield their fruit.
26.21: And if you will walk with me contentiously and you will not be willing to listen to me, I shall add upon you plagues, each by sevens, for your sins.
26.22: And I shall send upon you beasts of the field and they shall bereave you and shall destroy your domestic animals and they shall diminish you and your roads shall be desolate.
26.23: And if in these things, you again will not be instructed, and you will walk with me contentiously;
26.24: I shall walk also with you contentiously and I shall strike you also, each sevenfold for your sins.
26.25: And I shall bring upon you a sword to avenge with the vengeance of the covenant, and you shall flee to your cities and I shall send among you a plague, and you shall be given into the hand of your enemies.
26.26: And I shall break the stalk of your grain and ten women shall bake your bread in one oven and they shall give to you bread by weight, and you shall eat and you shall not be satisfied.
26.27: And if in these things you again will not listen to me and you will walk with me contentiously;
26.28: Also I shall walk with you in anger and in contention and I shall chasten you each sevenfold for your sins.
26.29: And you shall eat the flesh of your sons and you will eat the flesh of your daughters.
26.30: And I shall destroy your shrines and I shall destroy your idols and I shall cast your corpses on the bodies of your idols and my soul shall detest you.
26.31: And I shall make your cities into a wilderness and I shall lay waste your sanctuaries and I shall not smell the fragrance of your savors.
26.32: And I shall destroy also the land and your enemies who dwell in it shall be astonished over it.
26.33: And I shall scatter you among the nations and I shall unsheathe a sword after you, and destruction shall possess your land and your cities shall be a wilderness.
26.34: And then the land will be pleased in its Sabbaths all of the days of its desolation, when you are in the land of your enemies, and then the land shall rest and it shall be pleased in its Sabbaths.
26.35: All of the days of its desolation it shall rest because it did not rest on your Sabbaths when you were dwelling in it.
26.36: And into the hearts of those who are left among you I shall cast trepidation, in the lands of their enemies, and the sound of leaves stirring will chase them, and they will flee as escaping from before the sword, and they will fall when there is no one chasing them.
26.37: And a man shall be stumbled by his brother as one before a sword when there is no one chasing them, and there will be no standing before their enemies.
26.38: And you shall be destroyed among the nations and the land of your enemies shall consume you.
26.39: And those who remain among you will putrefy in their evil in the land of their enemies, also they will rot in the evil of their fathers.
26.40: And they shall confess their evil and the evil of their fathers in the evil that they have done to me; and because they walked with me in contention;
26.41: Also I shall walk with them in contention, and I shall bring them to the land of their enemies, and then their uncircumcised heart will be broken and then they will acknowledge their evil:
26.42: And I shall remember my covenant with Yaquuv and my covenant with Isaaq and I shall remember my covenant with Abraham and I shall remember the land.
26.43: And the land shall be forsaken of them and it shall be pleased in its Sabbaths whenever it is deserted by them, and they shall acknowledge their evil because they rejected my judgment and their souls loathed my commands.
26.44: Also when they were in the land of their enemies I did not despise them and I have not cast them off and I have not destroyed them and I have not discontinued my covenant with them.
26.45: But I have remembered for them the first covenant because I AM LORD JEHOVAH their God who brought them out from the land of Egypt before the eyes of the nations, and I have been their God; I AM LORD JEHOVAH."
26.46: These are the commandments and the laws and the judgments which LORD JEHOVAH gave between him and the children of Israel into the hand of Moshe in the mountain of Sinai.

27.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
27.2: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them: ‘When a man dedicates a vow with the price of persons to LORD JEHOVAH.
27.3: The price of a male from a son of twenty years and above and unto a son of sixty years shall be the price of fifty shekels of silver in the shekel of Holiness.
27.4: And if it is a female, her price shall be thirty shekels.
27.5: And if from a son of five years and unto a son of twenty years, the price of males shall be twenty shekels.
27.6: And of the females, ten shekels, and if from a son of a month and unto a son of five years the price of males shall be five shekels of silver, and of females, three shekels of silver.
27.7: And if it is a male from a son of sixty years and above, the price shall be fifteen shekels, and of the female, ten shekels.
27.8: And if he is poorer than the price, he shall present himself before the Priest and the Priest will cut down the price according to what is enough in the hands of him who vows a vow; in this way the Priest will cut down the price.
27.9: And if it is a beast from which they bring a gift to LORD JEHOVAH, all that he gives of it to LORD JEHOVAH shall be holy.
27.10: He shall not exchange a good one for a bad one, or an afflicted one for good one, and if he will exchange a beast to be exchanged for a beast, it and its exchange shall be holy to LORD JEHOVAH.
27.11: And if a beast is unclean that they do not accept from it as an offering to LORD JEHOVAH, he shall present the animal before the Priest:
27.12: And the Priest will cut its price between good and bad, and according to that price to which the Priest cut, so it shall be.
27.13: And if he will certainly redeem it, he shall add one fifth to its price.
27.14: And if a man will hallow his household as holiness to LORD JEHOVAH, the Priest will cut its price between the good and the bad, and according to that price to which the Priest cut, so it shall stand.
27.15: And if he who hallows will repurchase his household, he will add one fifth the money of its price to it and it will be his.
27.16: And if a man will hallow from the field of his inheritance to LORD JEHOVAH, its price shall be in proportion to his seed among the seed of a Cor eleven bushels of barley, with fifty shekels of money.
27.17: And if from the year of restoration he will hallow his field according to its price, thus it shall stand.
27.18: And if after the restoration he will hallow the field, the Priest will account to him the money in proportion to the years that are left until the year of restoration, and he shall deduct from its price.
27.19: And if he will surely redeem that field from him who hallows it, he will add onefifth the money of the proceeds for it and it shall be his.
27.20: And if he will not repurchase the field and will sell it to another man again, it shall not be redeemed.
27.21: But the field, when it will go out in the restoration, will be holy to LORD JEHOVAH as a field that is devoted; it will be the inheritance of the Priest.
27.22: And if the field is of a purchase and was not the field of an inheritance a man hallows to LORD JEHOVAH;
27.23: The Priest will figure its price until the year of restoration and he will give its price in that day, holy to LORD JEHOVAH.
27.24: And in the year of restoration, the field shall be returned to him who had sold it, whose inheritance of land it is.
27.25: And its whole price shall be in shekels; twenty farthings is a shekel.
27.26: However the first born which is first born to LORD JEHOVAH from an animal, a man shall not hallow; if it is an ox or a sheep, it is LORD JEHOVAH’s.
27.27: And if a beast is unclean, it will be bought with a price and will add one fifth to it and if it is not repurchased, it shall be sold with a price.
27.28: However every devoted thing that a man devoted to LORD JEHOVAH from everything that he has, of men and of beast and from the field of his inheritance, will not be sold and will not be redeemed; every devoted thing is Holy of Holy things to LORD JEHOVAH.
27.29: And no devoted thing devoted of men shall be repurchased but surely shall be killed.
27.30: And every tenth of the land of the seed of the land and of the fruit of the trees of LORD JEHOVAH, it is holiness to LORD JEHOVAH.
27.31: And if a man will redeem from his tithe, he will add to it one fifth.
27.32: And every tenth of oxen and of sheep, everything that passes under the staff that grazes shall be holy to LORD JEHOVAH.
27.33: He shall not inquire between good and bad and between bad and good and he shall not exchange it, and if he will exchange it, that and its exchange shall be holy and it shall not be repurchased.'"
27.34: These are the commandments that LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe concerning the children of Israel in the mountain of Sinai.

1.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe in the wilderness of Sinai in the Time Tabernacle, in the first day, in the second month, in the second year when the children of Israel went out from the land of Egypt, and he said to him:
1.2: “And take the count of the number of the leaders of all of the assembly of the children of Israel for their tribes to the house of their fathers in the number of their names, every male for their leaders.
1.3: From a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel, you shall number them in their armies, you and Ahron your brother.
1.4: And each head man from the tribe of the house of his father shall be with you.
1.5: And these are the names of the men who will stand with you: of Rubil: Elitsur son of Shedaur.
1.6: Of Shemon: Shelamwayel, son of Shurishaday.
1.7: Of Yehuda: Nahshon, son of Aminadab.
1.8: Of Issakar: Nathaniel, son of Tsuar.
1.9: Of Zebulun: Elyab, son of Khelon.
1.10: Of the sons of Yoseph: of Aphreim: Elishma, son of Amihud of Menasheh: Gamaliel, son of Partsur.
1.11: Of Benyamin: Abidan, son of Geduni.
1.12: Of Dan: Akhiazar, son of Amishaday.
1.13: Of Ashayr: Pagayel, son of Akran.
1.14: Of Gad: Eliasaph, son of Rawayel.
1.15: Of Naphtali: Akhida, son of Aynan.
1.16: These are the prominent of the assembly, Princes of the tribes of the house of their fathers; they are the Heads of the thousands of Israel.”
1.17: And Moshe and Ahron took these men who were separated by names.
1.18: And they gathered all of the assembly on the first in the second month and they were numbered for their tribes with the house of their fathers in the number of the names of a son of twenty years and above for their Leaders.
1.19: As LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe and he numbered them in the wilderness of Sinai.
1.20: And there were the children of Rubil, the firstborn of Israel in their families, for their tribes, for the house of their fathers, in the number of the names, every male for their Leaders, from a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.21: The number of them of the tribe of Rubil: forty and six thousand five hundred.
1.22: And the sons of Shemon in their families for their tribes, for the house of their fathers in the number of the names, every male for their Leaders, of a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.23: The number of them of the tribe of Shemon: fifty and nine thousand and three hundred.
1.24: And the sons of Gad in their families, for their tribes for the house of their fathers, in the number of the names, every male for their Leaders, from a son of twenty years and above, everyone who proceeds in the army in Israel.
1.25: The number of them of the tribe of Gad: forty and five thousand and six hundred and fifty.
1.26: And the sons of Yehuda in their families, for their tribes for the house of their fathers, in the number of the names of a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.27: The number of them of the tribe of Yehuda: seventy and four thousand and six hundred.
1.28: And the sons of Issakar in their families for their tribes for the house of their fathers, in the number of the names of a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.29: The number of them of the tribe of Issakar: fifty and four thousand and four hundred.
1.30: And the sons of Zebulon in their families, for their tribes for the house of their fathers, in the number of the names of a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.31: The number of them of the tribe of Zebulon: fifty and seven thousand and four hundred.
1.32: And the sons of Yoseph the sons of Aphreim in their families for their tribes to the house their fathers, in the number of the names of a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.33: The number of them of the tribe of Aphreim: forty thousand and five hundred.
1.34: And the sons of Menasheh in their families for their tribes, for the house of their fathers, in the number of the names of a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.35: The number of them of the tribe of Menasheh: thirty and two thousand and two hundred.
1.36: And the sons of Benyamin in their families for their tribes for the house of their fathers, in the number of the names of a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.37: The number of them of the tribe of Benyamin: thirty and five thousand and four hundred.
1.38: And the sons of Dan in their families, for their tribes to the house of their fathers, in the number of the names of a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.39: The number of them of the tribe of Dan: sixty and two thousand and seven hundred.
1.40: And the sons of Ashir in their families, for their tribes for the house of their fathers, in the number of the names of a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.41: The number of them of the tribe of Ashayr: forty and one thousand and five hundred.
1.42: And the sons of Naphtali in their families, for their tribes for the house of their fathers, in the number of the names of a son of twenty years and above, every who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.43: The number of them of the tribe of Naphtali: fifty and three thousand and four hundred.
1.44: These are the numbers that Moshe and Ahron numbered and the Princes of Israel, twelve men, one man from the house of his father.
1.45: And all of them of the number of the sons of Israel for the house of their fathers, of a son of twenty years and above, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.
1.46: And all of them the number of the sons of Israel were six hundred and three thousand and five hundred and fifty.
1.47: And the Levites and the tribe of their fathers were not numbered among them.
1.48: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
1.49: The tribe of Levi you shall not number and their computation you shall not take among the sons of Israel.
1.50: But authorize Levi over the Tabernacle of the Testimony and over all of its implements and over everything that is in it, those shall carry his tabernacle and all its implements and those shall serve it who shall be camping around the Tabernacle.
1.51: And whenever the Tabernacle picks up, the Levites shall take it down, and whenever the Tabernacle sets up, the Levites shall erect it and a stranger who approaches it shall be killed.
1.52: And the sons of Israel shall pitch, each man in his camp and each man in his troop in their armies.
1.53: And Levites shall be setting up around the Tabernacle of the Testimony and there shall not be wrath on the assembly of the children of Israel and the Levites shall keep watch of the Tabernacle of the Testimony."
1.54: And the children of Israel did as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe; in this way they did.

2.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and with Ahron and said to them:
2.2: "A man shall camp in his troop in the places of the house of their fathers; the children of Israel shall dwell. opposite and around the Time Tabernacle.
2.3: And they who camp first from the East are the troop of the camp of Yehuda, their army and the Ruler of the sons of Yehuda: Nakhshon son of Aminadab.
2.4: And the number of his army: seventy and four thousand and six hundred.
2.5: And they who camp with the tribe of Issakar and the Ruler of the sons of Issakar: Nathaniel son of Tsuar.
2.6: And the number of his army: fifty and four thousand and four hundred.
2.7: And the rod of Zebulon and the Ruler of the sons of Zebulon: Eliab son of Khelon.
2.8: And the number of the army: fifty and seven thousand and four hundred.
2.9: All the number of the camp of Yehuda: a hundred and eighty and six thousand and four hundred for their armies; those shall be picking up first.
2.10: And the troop and the camp of Rubil from the south for their armies, and the Ruler of the sons of Rubil: Elitsur son of Shedur.
2.11: And the number of his army: forty and six thousand and five hundred.
2.12: And they who camp with the tribe of Shemon and the Ruler of the sons of Shemon: Shelemuil son of Tsurishadi.
2.13: And the number of his army: fifty and nine thousand and three hundred.
2.14: And the rod of Gad and the Ruler of the sons of Gad: Eliasaph son of Rawayel.
2.15: And the number of his army: forty and five thousand and six hundred and fifty.
2.16: All the number of the camp of Rubil: a hundred and fifty and one thousand and four hundred and fifty to their army; they were picking up after the first.
2.17: And the camp of Levites picked up the Time Tabernacle inside the camp; they were picking up just as they camped: each man with his troop for their armies.
2.18: And the troop of the camp of Aphreim for their armies from the West and the Leader for their armies of the children of Aphreim: Elishama son of Amihud.
2.19: And the number of the army: forty thousand and five hundred.
2.20: And they who camp with him are the tribe of Menasheh and the Ruler of the sons of Menasheh: Gamaliel son of Pertsur.
2.21: And the number of his army: thirty and two thousand and two hundred.
2.22: And the rod of Benyamin and the Leader of the sons of Benyamin: Abidan son of Gideoni.
2.23: And the number of his army: thirty and five thousand and four hundred.
2.24: All the number of the camp of Aphreim: a hundred and eighty thousand and one hundred for their army; they shall pick up after the second.
2.25: The troop of the camp of Dan from the north for his army and the Head of the sons of Dan: Akhiazar son of Amishdai.
2.26: And the number of his army: sixty and two thousand and seven hundred.
2.27: And they who camp with it are the tribe of Ashayr, and the Ruler of the sons of Ashayr: Pagayel son of Akran.
2.28: And the number of his army: forty and one thousand and five hundred.
2.29: And the rod of Naphtali and the Ruler of the sons of Naphtali: Akhida son of Ainan.
2.30: And the number of his army: fifty and three thousand and four hundred.
2.31: All the number of the camp of Dan: a hundred and fifty and seven thousand and six hundred; in the last troop they shall be picking up.
2.32: These are the numbers of the children of Israel for the house of their fathers; all of the numbers of the camp for their army: six hundred and three thousand and five hundred and fifty.
2.33: And the Levites and the rod of their fathers shall not be counted among the children of Israel as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe."
2.34: And the children of Israel did everything that LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe, in this way they did, and thus they were camping in their troops, and thus they were camping, each man in his camp by the house of his father.

3.1: And these are the families of Ahron and of Moshe in the day when LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe in the mountain of Sinai.
3.2: And these are the names of the sons of Ahron the firstborn: Nadab and Abihu and Eliazar and Ithamar.
3.3: These are the names of the sons of Ahron the Priest who were anointed and they consecrated their hands to the Priesthood.
3.4: And Nadab and Abihu died before LORD JEHOVAH when they offered foreign fire before LORD JEHOVAH in the wilderness of Sinai and they had no sons, and Eliazer and Ithamar served as Priest in the life of Ahron their father.
3.5: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
3.6: “Bring the tribe of Levi and present it before Ahron the Priest and it shall serve him.
3.7: And they shall keep his charge and the charge of all the assembly before LORD JEHOVAH before the Time Tabernacle to do service in the Tabernacle.
3.8: And they shall keep all the implements of the Time Tent and the guarding of the children of Israel to do the service of the Tabernacle.
3.9: And you shall give the Levites to Ahron and to his sons; they are a gift given to him from within the sons of Israel.
3.10: And command Ahron and his sons and they shall keep their Priesthood, and the foreigner who comes near to them will be killed.”
3.11: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
3.12: “Behold, I have taken the Levites from within the children of Israel in place of every firstborn that opens every womb from the children of Israel, that the Levites will be mine.
3.13: Because every firstborn is mine; in the day that I killed every firstborn that was in the land of Egypt, I hallowed every firstborn of the children of Israel to me from man and unto animal; they shall be mine; I AM LORD JEHOVAH.”
3.14: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe in the wilderness of Sinai and said to him,
3.15: “Count the sons of Levi for the house of their fathers by their families; you shall count them, every male from a son of a month and above.”
3.16: And Moshe numbered them by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH as he was commanded.
3.17: And these were the sons of Levi by their names: Gershun and Qahath and Merari.
3.18: And these are the names of the sons of Gershun for their tribes: Lebni and Shimei.
3.19: And the sons of Qahath for their tribes: Amram and Yatzhar and Khebron and Uziel.
3.20: And the sons of Merari for their tribes: Makhli and Mushi; these are the families of Levi according to the house of their fathers.
3.21: For Gershun: the family of the Libnites and the family of the Shimites, these are the families of Gershun.
3.22: And their number in the number of every male from a son of a month and above: seven thousand and five hundred.
3.23: The family of Gershun shall be camping behind the Tabernacle from the West.
3.24: And the Ruler of the house of the fathers of Gershun: Eliasaph son of Eliab.
3.25: And the keeping of the sons of Gershun in the Time Tabernacle, the Tabernacle and the curtain, the door and its veil and the veil of the door of the courtyard that is next to the Time Tabernacle.
3.26: And the curtain rods of the courtyard and the veil of the door of the courtyard that is next to the Tabernacle and next to the altar as a circle, and its cords and all its works.
3.27: And Qahath’s family of Amram and the family of the Yatzharites and the family of Khebrun and the family of Uziel; these are the families of Qahath.
3.28: And their number in the number of every male from a son of a month and above: eight thousand and six hundred keeping the watch of Holiness.
3.29: And the family of the house of Qahath will dwell on the borders of the Tabernacle from the South.
3.30: And the Ruler of the house of the fathers of the family of Qahath: Elitsaphan son of Uziel.
3.31: And their charge: the Ark and the table and the menorahs and the altar and the implements of holiness with which they serve, and the door curtain and all its service.
3.32: And the Head of the Rulers of Levi: Eliazer the son of Ahron the Priest, who was authorized over the keepers of the keeping of Holiness.
3.33: And Marari’s family of Makhli and the family of Mushi: these are the families of Marari.
3.34: And their number in the number of every male from a son of a month and above: six thousand and two hundred.
3.35: And the Ruler of the house of the fathers of the families of Merari: Tsuriel son of Abikhel; they shall be camping on the side of the Tabernacle from the North.
3.36: And authority of the keeping of the sons of Merari: the boards of the Tabernacle and its bars and its posts and its sockets and all its implements and all its service.
3.37: And the pillars of the courtyard surrounding and their cords and their sockets and their curtain rods.
3.38: And they who camp before the Tabernacle from the East before the Time Tent from the East: Moshe and Ahron and his sons who keep the guard of Holiness by the guard of the children of Israel, and a stranger approaching will be killed.
3.39: All of the number of Levi whom Moshe numbered by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH, every male from a son of a month and above: twenty and two thousand.
3.40: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him: “Number every firstborn male of the children of Israel from a son of a month and above and take the number of their names.
3.41: And you shall bring the Levites to me (I AM LORD JEHOVAH), in the place of all of the firstborn ones of the children of Israel, and the domestic animals of Levi in the place of all firstborn ones of the domestic animals of the children of Israel.”
3.42: And Moshe numbered all of the firstborn of the children of Israel according to what LORD JEHOVAH commanded him.
3.43: And all firstborn males by the number of the names of a son of a month and above, the number of them was twenty and two thousand and two hundred and seventy and three.
3.44: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
3.45: “Bring the Levites in the place of every firstborn of the children of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites in the place of their cattle, and the Levites shall be mine; I AM LORD JEHOVAH.
3.46: And the redemption of the two hundred and seventy and three more than the Levites, the firstborn of the children Israel:
3.47: Take five shekels for a head in the shekel of Holiness; take twenty mayn to a shekel.
3.48: And take the money of redemption of those who exceed them to Ahron and to his sons.”
3.49: And Moshe took the money of redemption from those who exceeded for the redemption of the Levites.
3.50: From the firstborn of the children of Israel, and he took the money: one thousand three hundred and sixty and five shekels in the shekel of Holiness.
3.51: And Moshe gave the money of redemption to Ahron and his sons according to the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH, as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe.

4.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and with Ahron and said to them:
4.2: “Take an accounting of the sons of Qahath from within the sons of Levi for their families for the house of their fathers.
4.3: From a son of thirty years and above, and unto outside fifty years, all who come into the host to do work in the Time Tent.
4.4: This is the service of the sons of Qahath in the Time tent, The Holy of Holies.
4.5: And Ahron will enter and his sons whenever the camp pick up and they shall take down the veil of the door of the curtain and they shall cover the Ark of the Testimony with it.
4.6: And they shall cover a membrane of leather of vermillionsky blue over it and they shall cover with a perfect robe of dark bluepurple from above and they shall set its poles.
4.7: And over the table of faces they shall cover with a robe of dark blue and they will set up flasks and spoons and bowls and ladles of drink offerings on it and the bread shall be constantly upon it.
4.8: And they shall cover over it with a robe of scarlet and they shall cover it with a membrane of leather of vermillionsky blue that its poles may be set out.
4.9: And they shall take a robe of dark blue and they shall cover the lamp stand that gives light and its lamps and its snuffers and its spoons and all vessels of oil with which they serve it.
4.10: And they shall put it and all its implements in a cover of leather of sky blue and they will set it on its poles.
4.11: And upon the altar of gold they shall cover with a perfect robe of dark blue and they shall cover it with a covering of leather of sky blue and they will set its poles.
4.12: And they shall take all of the implements of ministry with which they minister in holiness and they will put them in a robe of dark blue and they shall cover them in a cover of leather of sky blue and they will put them on poles.
4.13: And they shall remove the altar and they shall cover over it with a robe of purple.
4.14: And they will put with it all of its implements with which they minister upon it, the censers and the forks and the shovels and the fire pans and all of the implements of the altar, and they shall cover over it a membrane of leather of sky blue and they will set its poles.
4.15: And when Ahron has finished and his sons covering the holy place and all the garments of Holiness when he picked up camp, then the sons of Qahath shall enter to pick up, that they shall not touch Holiness and die; these are the removals of the sons of Qahath that are in the Time Tent.
4.16: And the authority of Eliazar the son of Ahron the Priest of the oil of the lamps and incense of sweet spices and constant meal offering and oil of anointing; he is authorized over all the Tabernacle and over everything that is in it and in the Holy Place and with its implements.”
4.17: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and with Ahron and said to them:
4.18: “You shall not destroy the tribe of the family of Qahath from within the Levites.
4.19: But do this to them and they will live, lest they will die when they enter the Holy Holies; Ahron and his sons shall enter and they shall authorize them, each man over his service and over its removal.
4.20: And they shall not enter to see when the holy things are covered lest they die.”
4.21: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
4.22: “Take an accounting of the sons of Gershun, also of the house of their fathers for their tribes.
4.23: From a son of thirty years and above and unto a son of fifty years you shall number them, everyone who comes to be enabled in power and to perform the service in the Time Tent.
4.24: This is the service of the family of Gershun to minister and to remove:
4.25: They shall take up the curtains of the Tabernacle and the Time Tabernacle.
4.26: And the curtain rods of the courtyard and the curtain of the entrance of the door of the courtyard that is next to the Tabernacle, and next to the altar as a circle, and their cords and all implements of their ministry, everything that they were performing and they were ministering.
4.27: All the service of the sons of Gershun shall be by the word of the mouth of Ahron and of his sons for all their removal and all their ministry and you shall authorize upon them the keeping over all their removal.
4.28: This is the service of the family of the sons of Gershun that is in the Time Tent and their guarding by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Ahron the Priest.
4.29: And you shall number the sons of Marari for their families for the house of their fathers.
4.30: From a son of thirty years and above and unto a son of fifty years, you shall number them, everyone who comes to be able in power and to do service in the Time Tent.
4.31: And this is the guard of their cargo and of all their service in the Time Tabernacle, the boards of the Tabernacle, its bars and its pillars and its sockets.
4.32: And the pillars of the courtyard as a circle, and their sockets and their pegs and their cords and all their implements and all their service; count by name the implements of the keeping of their cargo.
4.33: This is the service of families of the sons of Marari and all their service in the Time Tent by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Ahron the Priest."
4.34: And Moshe and Ahron and the Leaders of the assembly numbered the sons of Qahath by their families for the house of their fathers.
4.35: From a son of thirty years and above and unto a son of fifty years, everyone who comes into the host to the service of the Time Tent.
4.36: And their number by their families was two thousand and seven hundred and fifty.
4.37: These were the numbers of the family of Qahath, everyone who serves in the Time Tent whom Moshe and Ahron numbered by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH by the agency of Moshe.
4.38: And the number of the sons of Gershun by their families for the house of their fathers.
4.39: From a son of thirty years and above and unto a son of fifty years, everyone who comes into the host for the service of the Time Tent.
4.40: And this is their number by their families by the house of their fathers: two thousand and six hundred and thirty.
4.41: These are the numbers of the family of the sons of Gershun, everyone who served in the Time Tent whom Moshe and Ahron numbered by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH.
4.42: And the number of the family of the sons of Marari for their families for the house of their fathers.
4.43: From a son of three years and above and unto a son of five years, everyone who comes into the host to the service of the Time Tabernacle.
4.44: And their number for their families for the house of their fathers was three thousand and two hundred.
4.45: These are the numbers of genealogies of the sons of Merari that Moshe numbered and Ahron by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH by the agency of Moshe.
4.46: Every number that Moshe and Ahron and the Rulers of Israel numbered for the Levites, for their tribes, for the house of their fathers.
4.47: From a son of thirty years and above and unto a son of fifty years, everyone who comes into the host to do work in the service and the service of the removal in the Time Tabernacle:
4.48: Eight thousand and five hundred and eighty.
4.49: By the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH they numbered them by the agency of Moshe, each man for his service and for his removing, and he numbered them as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe.

5.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
5.2: “Command the children of Israel that they put everyone who is a leper and everyone who has a discharge and everyone who is defiled in himself outside of the camp.
5.3: From male and unto female you shall put out them outside of the camp and they shall not defile your camps, for I dwell among you.”
5.4: And the children of Israel did in this way and they took them outside of the camp, and as LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe, so the children of Israel did.
5.5: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
5.6: “Say to the children of Israel: ‘If a man or a woman will commit any sin of the children of men and they will do evil before LORD JEHOVAH, that soul shall be condemned.
5.7: And they shall confess their sins that they have done and he shall return his sin on his head, and he shall add one fifth to it and return it to him whose the sin offering is.
5.8: And if the man does not have one who is near to him, he may bring a sin offering for the sake of sin for his person that they bring for his sake before LORD JEHOVAH to the Priest; it shall be apart from the ram of the atonement by which he is atoned.
5.9: And every offering of all holy things that the children of Israel bring to the Priest shall be his.
5.10: And a man’s holy thing shall be his, and a man who gives to the Priest, it shall be his.'"
5.11: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
5.12: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them: ‘When a man’s wife will go wrong and she will do evil to him.
5.13: And a man will have sexual intercourse with her, copulating with seed, and it is hidden from the eyes of her husband, and it is secret, and she is defiled, and there is no witness against her and she is not caught.
5.14: And a spirit of jealousy shall come on her husband and he becomes jealous against his wife when she was defiled, or a spirit of jealousy will come upon him and he becomes jealous against his wife when she was not defiled.
5.15: The man shall bring his offering to the Priest: one tenth ephah of barley flour, and he shall not pour oil upon it and he shall not lay frankincense upon it, because it is a meal offering, because it is a jealousy meal offering of a memorial that recalls sin.
5.16: The Priest shall bring her and she shall stand before LORD JEHOVAH.
5.17: And the Priest shall take holy water in a vessel of a potter and the Priest shall take some dust that is in the base of the altar and throw it in the water.
5.18: And the Priest shall stand the woman before LORD JEHOVAH and he shall shave the head of the woman and he shall put the meal offering of remembrance, the meal offering of jealousy in her hands, for bitter testing waters shall be in the hands of the Priest.
5.19: And the Priest shall put the woman under oath and shall say to her: "If a man has not had sexual intercourse with you and you have not done wrong and you have not been defiled outside of your husband, be cleared from these bitter waters of testing.
5.20: But if you have done wrong outside of your husband and you are defiled and a man other than your husband had sexual intercourse with you.”
5.21: The Priest shall put the woman under oath in the oath of a curse and the Priest shall say to the Woman: "LORD JEHOVAH shall give you a curse and an oath within your people; LORD JEHOVAH shall rot your thigh; your belly shall swell up.
5.22: And these testing waters shall enter your belly and they shall swell your fountains and they shall rot your thighs”, and that woman shall say, "Amen, Amen.”
5.23: And the Priest shall write these curses in a scroll and he shall blot them out with the water of testing.
5.24: And the woman shall drink the bitter testing water and the testing waters shall enter into her to test her.
5.25: And the Priest shall take the meal offering of jealousy from the hands of the woman and he shall offer the meal offering before LORD JEHOVAH and he shall offer it up on the altar.
5.26: And the Priest shall offer the memorial of the meal offering and he shall offer it on the altar and then he shall make the woman drink the water.
5.27: And if she has been defiled and she has done evil to her husband, and the testing waters entered into her and they tested her and her belly swelled up and her thigh has rotted, that woman will be for a curse from within her people.
5.28: But if that woman is not defiled and she is pure, she shall be spared and she shall bear a male.
5.29: This is the law of jealousy when a woman does wrong apart from her husband and she shall be defiled.
5.30: Or a man upon whom will enter a spirit of jealousy and he will be jealous against his wife and he shall stand the woman before LORD JEHOVAH and the Priest will do to her this whole law.
5.31: And that man will be absolved from sin and that woman shall carry her sin.’”

6.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
6.2: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them: ‘A man or a woman who will separate and will vow the vow of a Nazarite and will be separated to LORD JEHOVAH.
6.3: Shall separate from wine and from strong drink; such shall not drink vinegar of wine or vinegar of strong liquor nor shall drink any juice of grapes nor shall eat grapes or raisins.
6.4: All of the days of his Nazaritehood, everything that is made from the vine of grape juice, from the skins and unto the grape stones, he shall not eat.
6.5: All of the days of the vow of his Nazaritehood; and a razor not will pass on his head until the days when he is separated to LORD JEHOVAH may be fulfilled; he shall be holy and shall grow the hairs of his head.
6.6: All of the days that he is separated to LORD JEHOVAH; and he shall not enter upon the person of the dead.
6.7: And he shall not be defiled by them, with his father or with his mother or with his brother or with his sister, in their death, because the crown of his God is on his head.
6.8: All of the days of his Nazaritehood; he is holy to LORD JEHOVAH.
6.9: And if the dead should die upon him suddenly, the head of his Nazaritehood shall be defiled and he shall shave his head in the day of purifying and the seventh day he shall shave it.
6.10: And the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two young doves to the Priest, to the door of the Time Tabernacle.
6.11: One in exchange for sin and one for a burnt peace offering, and he shall atone for him for the sin that he sinned by the person, and he shall hallow his head in that day.
6.12: And he shall be separated before LORD JEHOVAH the days of his Nazaritehood and he shall bring a lamb, a son of a year, for an offering, and the former days shall be nullified because his Nazaritehood was defiled.
6.13: This is the law of the Nazarite in the days when the days of his Nazaritehood are fulfilled; he shall be brought to the door of the Time Tabernacle.
6.14: And he shall offer his offering to LORD JEHOVAH: one lamb, a son, a year old that has no defect, for a burnt offering, and one ewe lamb, a daughter of a year that has no flaw in her, in the place of sin, and one ram that has no flaw for a peace sacrifice.
6.15: And a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of fine flour that is mixed with oil and unleavened wafers that are anointed with oil and their meal offerings and their drink offerings.
6.16: And the Priest shall bring it before LORD JEHOVAH and he shall offer his sin offering and his burnt peace offering.
6.17: And he shall make a ram a peace sacrifice to LORD JEHOVAH on a basket of unleavened bread, and the Priest shall make his meal offering and his drink offering.
6.18: And the Nazarite shall shave the head of his separation in the gate of the Time Tabernacle and he shall take the hair of the head of his separation and he shall put it in the fire that is under the peace sacrifice.
6.19: And the Priest shall take the boiled shoulder of the ram and one unleavened cake from the basket and one unleavened wafer, and he shall put it in the hands of the Nazarite after he shaves his Nazaritehood.
6.20: And the Priest shall set them apart as a dedication before LORD JEHOVAH; it is holy to the Priest with the breast of dedication and with the shank of dedication, and then the Nazarite will drink wine.
6.21: This is the law of the Nazarite who vows to LORD JEHOVAH an offering for his separation apart from whatever he is capable of, according to what is enough; the vow that he vows, in this way he shall do, by the law of his Nazaritehood.’”
6.22: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him.
6.23: “Speak with Ahron and with his sons and say to them: ‘In this way you shall bless the children of Israel: say to them.
6.24: “LORD JEHOVAH shall bless you and shall preserve you.
6.25: LORD JEHOVAH shall shine his faces upon you and he shall give you life.
6.26: LORD JEHOVAH shall lift his faces upon you and make peace for you.”
6.27: And they shall put My Name on the children of Israel and I shall bless them.’”

7.1: And it was in the day that Moshe finished his establishment of the Tabernacle, he anointed it and he hallowed it for him and all its implements, and the altar and all its implements; he anointed them and hallowed them.
7.2: And the Rulers of the children of Israel approached, the Heads of the house of their fathers, those Princes of the tribes, those who preside over the census.
7.3: And they brought their offerings before LORD JEHOVAH: six carts set in order, and twelve oxen, a cart for two Princes and an ox to each, and they brought them before the Tabernacle.
7.4: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe,
7.5: “Take of them and they shall be for performing the service in the Time Tent among them, and give them to the Levites, each man, enough for his service.”
7.6: And Moshe took the oxen and the wagons and delivered them to the Levites.
7.7: Two wagons and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershun, enough for their service.
7.8: And four wagons and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, enough for their service into the hand of Ithamar, son of Ahron the Priest.
7.9: And he did not give to the sons of Qahath, because of the labor of the sanctuary delivered to them, and they carry upon their shoulders.
7.10: And the Princes brought gifts of the dedication of the altar in the day when they anointed it, and the Princes brought their offerings before LORD JEHOVAH.
7.11: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe, “One Ruler per day shall be bringing their offerings for the dedication of the altar.”
7.12: And Nahshon son of Aminadab, the Chief of the tribe of the house Yehuda, was bringing his offering on the first day.
7.13: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels, by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour sprinkled with oil for an offering.
7.14: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.15: And one ox, son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, son of a year, for a burnt offering.
7.16: And one kid of goats for the sake of sins.
7.17: And for a peace sacrifice, two bulls, five rams and five goats, and five lambs, offspring of a year old, this is the offering of Nakhshon son of Aminadab.
7.18: And in the second day, the Head of the tribe of Issakar, Nathaniel son of Tsuar, came.
7.19: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels, by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour mixed with oil for an offering.
7.20: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.21: And one ox, son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, son of a year, for a burnt offering.
7.22: And one kid of goats for the sake of sin.
7.23: And the peace sacrifice: two bulls and five rams and five goats, and five lambs, male offspring of a year; this is the offering of Nathaniel son of Tsuar.
7.24: And in the third day, the Head of the tribe of Zebulon, Elyab son of Khalun, came.
7.25: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the offering.
7.26: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.27: And one ox, a son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, a son of a year for a burnt offering.
7.28: And one kid of goats for a sin offering.
7.29: And for the peace sacrifice: two bulls and five rams and five goats and five lambs, male offspring of a year; this is the offering of Elyab son of Khalun.
7.30: And in the fourth day, the Head of the tribe of Rubil, Elitsur son of Shedayur, came.
7.31: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the offering.
7.32: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.33: And one ox, a son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, a son of a year for a burnt offering.
7.34: And one kid of goats for a sin offering.
7.35: And for the peace sacrifice: two bulls and five rams and five goats and five lambs, male offspring of a year; this is the offering of Elitsur son of Shedayur.
7.36: And in the fifth day, the Head of the tribe of Shemon, Shlamayel son of Tsurishaday, came.
7.37: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels, by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the offering.
7.38: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.39: And one ox, a son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, a son of a year for a burnt offering.
7.40: And one kid of goats for a sin offering.
7.41: And for the peace sacrifice: two bulls and five rams and five goats and five lambs, male offspring of a year; this is the offering of Shlamayel son of Tsurishaday.
7.42: And in the sixth day the Head of the tribe of Gad, Elyasaph son of Reuil, came.
7.43: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels, by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the offering.
7.44: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.45: And one ox, a son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, a son of a year for a burnt offering.
7.46: And one kid of goats for a sin offering.
7.47: And for the peace sacrifice: two bulls and five rams and five goats and five lambs, male offspring of a year; this is the offering of Eliasaph son of Reuil.
7.48: And in the seventh day, the Head of the tribe of Aphreim, Elishama son of Amihud, came.
7.49: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels, by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the offering.
7.50: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.51: And one ox, a son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, a son of a year for a burnt offering.
7.52: And one kid of goats for a sin offering.
7.53: And for the peace sacrifice: two bulls and five rams and five goats and five lambs, male offspring of a year; this is the offering of Elishama son of Amihud.
7.54: And in the eighth day, the Head of the tribe of Menasheh, Gamaliel son of Partsur, came.
7.55: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels, by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the offering.
7.56: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.57: And one ox, a son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, a son of a year for a burnt offering.
7.58: And one kid of goats for a sin offering.
7.59: And for the peace sacrifice: two bulls and five rams and five goats and five lambs, male offspring of a year; this is the offering of Gamaliel son of Partsur.
7.60: And in the ninth day, the Head of the tribe of Benyamin, Abidan son of Geduni, came.
7.61: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels, by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the offering.
7.62: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.63: And one ox, a son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, a son of a year for a burnt offering.
7.64: And one kid of goats for a sin offering.
7.65: And for the peace sacrifice: two bulls and five rams and five goats and five lambs, male offspring of a year; this is the offering of Elishama son of Amihud.
7.66: And in the tenth day, the Head of the tribe of Dan, Akhiazar son of Amishdaya, came.
7.67: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels, by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the offering.
7.68: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.69: And one ox, a son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, a son of a year for a burnt offering.
7.70: And one kid of goats for a sin offering.
7.71: And for the peace sacrifice: two bulls and five rams and five goats and five lambs, male offspring of a year; this is the offering of Akhiazar son of Amishdaya.
7.72: And in the eleventh day, the Head of the tribe of Ashayr, Pagayel son of Akran, came.
7.73: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels, by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the offering.
7.74: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.75: And one ox, a son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, a son of a year for a burnt offering.
7.76: And one kid of goats for a sin offering.
7.77: And for the peace sacrifice: two bulls and five rams and five goats and five lambs, male offspring of a year; this is the offering of Akhiazar son of Amishdaya.
7.78: And in the twelfth day, the Head of the tribe of Naphtali, Akhida son of Ainan, came.
7.79: His offering: one plate of silver of a hundred and thirty shekels and one saucer of silver of seventy shekels, by the shekel of Holiness, both being filled with fine flour mixed with oil for the offering.
7.80: And one spoon, ten shekels of gold, and filled with incense.
7.81: And one ox, a son of a herd, and one ram and one lamb, a son of a year for a burnt offering.
7.82: And one kid of goats for a sin offering.
7.83: And for the peace sacrifice: two bulls and five rams and five goats and five lambs, male offspring of a year; this is the offering of Akhida son of Ainan.
7.84: This was the offering of dedication of the altar in the day that it was anointed from the presence of the Princes of Israel: twelve plates of silver and twelve saucers of silver and twelve spoons of gold.
7.85: A hundred and thirty shekels of silver was of one plate and seventy of one saucer; all silver implements were two thousand and four hundred by the shekel of Holiness.
7.86: And twelve spoons of gold and being full of incense, being of ten shekels, the spoons were by the shekel of Holiness; all the gold of the spoons was a hundred and twenty shekels.
7.87: And all oxen for the burnt offering: twelve; twelve rams and twelve lambs, offspring of a year and their fine flour, and twelve kids of goats for sin.
7.88: And all oxen for the peace sacrifice: twenty and four; sixty rams and sixty goats, and sixty lambs, offspring of a year; this is the dedication of the altar after it was anointed.
7.89: And when Moshe entered the Time Tabernacle, he heard a voice speaking with him from the Mercy Seat above the Ark of the Testimony; between the two Cherubim, it spoke with him.

8.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
8.2: “Speak with Ahron and say to him: ‘Whenever you shall light the lamp opposite the face of the lamp stand, seven lamps shall be giving light.’”
8.3: And Ahron so made seven lamps opposite the face of the lamp stand and he lit its lamps as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe.
8.4: And this was the work of the menorah: it is of the forging of gold from its base and unto its top; it is of the forging according to the appearance that LORD JEHOVAH had shown Moshe; thus was the work for the menorah.
8.5: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
8.6: “Take the Levites from within the children of Israel and purify them.
8.7: In this way do to them and purify them: sprinkle upon them the waters of sins and they shall pass a razor on all their flesh and they shall wash their garments and they shall be purified.
8.8: And they shall take one bull, son of a herd, and its offering: one plate full of meal mixed with oil, and offer another bull, a son of a herd for sin.
8.9: And bring the Levites before the Time Tabernacle and gather all the assembly of the children of Israel.
8.10: And bring the Levites before LORD JEHOVAH and the children of Israel shall put their hands on the Levites.
8.11: And Ahron shall dedicate the Levites as a dedication before LORD JEHOVAH from the presence of the children of Israel and they shall be ministering the ministry of LORD JEHOVAH.
8.12: And the Levites shall put their hands on the head of the bull and make one for sin and one for a burnt offering to LORD JEHOVAH that he would be atoned for the Levites.
8.13: And stand the Levites before Ahron and before his sons and dedicate them as a dedication to LORD JEHOVAH.
8.14: And dedicate the Levites from within the children of Israel and the Levites shall be mine.
8.15: And after this the Levites shall enter and they shall serve in the Time Tabernacle; and purify them and consecrate them as a consecration before LORD JEHOVAH.
