8.16: Because they are a gift given to me from within the children of Israel, in the place of every firstborn one opening the womb of all of the children of Israel; I have brought them to me.
8.17: Because all the firstborn of the children of Israel, from the children of men and unto an animal are mine; in the day when I killed every firstborn of things that are in land of Egypt, I hallowed them to myself.
8.18: And I have brought the Levites in the place of the firstborn of the children Israel.
8.19: And I have given the Levites as a gift to Ahron and his children from within the children of Israel to do the service of the children of Israel in the Time Tabernacle and to make atonement for the children of Israel; and death shall not suddenly be among the children of Israel when the children of Israel come near to Holiness."
8.20: And Moshe and Ahron and all of the assembly of the children of Israel did to the Levites as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe about the Levites, so the children of Israel did to them.
8.21: And the Levites were cleansed and they washed their garments and Ahron consecrated the Levites as a consecration before LORD JEHOVAH and Ahron atoned for them and purified them.
8.22: And after the Levites entered to minister their ministry in the Time Tent before Ahron and before his sons, and as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe about the Levites, so the children of Israel did to them.
8.23: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
8.24: “This shall be the law of the Levites from a son of twenty and five years and above: he will come to be strengthened in power in the service of the Time Tabernacle.
8.25: And from fifty years old he will return from power of service and he shall serve no more.
8.26: And he shall serve his brothers in the Time Tabernacle and the work to keep guard; he shall not work; so do to the Levites in their charge."

9.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe in the wilderness of Sinai in the second year since the children of Israel came out from Egypt, in the first month, and he said to him:
9.2: “The children of Israel shall perform Passover in its time.
9.3: On the fourteenth in this month at sunset they shall perform it in its time; they shall perform it according to all its orders and according to all its judgments.”
9.4: And Moshe said to the children of Israel that they shall observe Passover.
9.5: And they observed Passover on the fourteenth of the first month, at sunset, in the wilderness of Sinai, according to what LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe; so the children of Israel did.
9.6: And men who were defiled by the persons of men were not able to observe Passover in that day, and they approached before Moshe and before Ahron on that day.
9.7: And they were saying to those men, “We are defiled by the person of a man; why are we forbidden and we do not bring the offering of LORD JEHOVAH in its time among the children of Israel?”
9.8: And Moshe said to them, “Stand on your place and I shall make heard what LORD JEHOVAH commands concerning you.”
9.9: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
9.10: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them, ‘When a man shall be defiled by a person or on a distant road or by your posterity, he shall keep Passover to LORD JEHOVAH.
9.11: In the fourteenth in the second month at sunset they shall keep it; they shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitters.
9.12: And not they shall leave any of it for the morning, and they shall not break a bone in it; they shall do it according to every commandment of Passover.
9.13: And a man that is pure and was not in the way and did not observe Passover in its time, that soul shall be cut off from his people, because he did not bring the offering of LORD JEHOVAH in its time; that man shall bear sin.
9.14: And when one who is converted to me will settle with you and he will observe Passover to LORD JEHOVAH according to the commandment of Passover and according to its judgments, thus he shall keep it; one law shall be for you and for the one who has turned to me and for the settler of the land.”
9.15: And in the day when the Tabernacle was raised up, a cloud covered the Time Tabernacle and at the door of the Testimony, and in the evening there was on the Tabernacle as the appearance of fire until the morning.
9.16: So it was constantly, and a cloud was covering it by day and the appearance of fire in the night.
9.17: And when the cloud was ascending from the Tabernacle, after this the children of Israel were picking up and in the place where the cloud abode on it, there the children of Israel pitched camp.
9.18: By the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH the children of Israel picked up and by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH all of them were pitching camp; they stayed for the days when the cloud abode on the Tabernacle.
9.19: And when the cloud continued on the Tabernacle for many days, Israel kept the charge of LORD JEHOVAH and did not pick up.
9.20: And there was time when the cloud was fewer days on the Tabernacle; by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH they stayed and by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH they picked up.
9.21: And there was a time when the cloud was on the Tabernacle from evening and unto the morning, and the cloud went up at dawn, and they picked up; whether the cloud went up day or night, they also were picking up.
9.22: Or days or months or time to time, however long the cloud was remaining on the Tabernacle, so the children of Israel remained and they did not pick up, and whenever the cloud went up, they picked up.
9.23: By the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH they remained and by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH they picked up, and they kept the charge of LORD JEHOVAH according to the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH by the agency of Moshe.

10.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
10.2: “Make for yourselves two horns of silver; make them of forged work and they shall be for you to call the assembly and to pick up camp.
10.3: And they shall sound with them and all of the assembly shall be gathered to you to the door of the Time Tabernacle.
10.4: And if they sound once, the Princes and the Leaders of the thousands of Israel shall gather to you.
10.5: And they shall blow reveille with a trumpet and they shall pick up the camps that dwell at the east.
10.6: And they shall blow reveille with a trumpet twice and they shall pick up the camps that dwell at the south; they shall sound with the trumpet for their removal.
10.7: And when you assemble, be sounding and not blowing reveille.
10.8: And the sons of Ahron the Priest shall sound with the trumpets and they shall be the law to you for eternity with your generations.
10.9: And if war will come to your land against the oppressor who oppresses you, blow reveille with the trumpets and you shall be remembered before LORD JEHOVAH your God and you shall be saved from your enemies.
10.10: And in the day of your joy and of your meetings and of the beginnings of your months, sound with the trumpets for your burnt offerings and for your peace offerings and they shall be to you for a memorial before your God; I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God.”
10.11: And it was in the year two, in the tenth in the second month, the cloud went up from the Tabernacle of the Testimony.
10.12: And the children of Israel picked up in their moving from the wilderness of Sinai, and the cloud dwelt in the wilderness of Paran.
10.13: And they picked up first at the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH by the agency of Moshe.
10.14: And they picked up first the troop of the camp of the sons of Yehuda by their armies and the Prince of the army: Nahshon son of Aminadab.
10.15: And Prince of the army of the tribe of the sons of Issakar: Nathaniel son of Tsuar.
10.16: And Prince of the army of the tribe of the sons of Zebulon: Eliab son of Khelon.
10.17: And they took down the Tabernacle and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, the bearers of the Tabernacle, picked up.
10.18: And the troop of the camp of Rubil and their army picked up; and Prince of the army: Elitsur son of Shedur.
10.19: And Prince of the army of the tribe of the sons of Shemon: Shlamayel son of Tsurishaday.
10.20: And Prince of the army of the tribe of the sons of Gad: Eliasaph son of Reuil.
10.21: And the sons of Qahath the bearers of the Tabernacle were picking up and erecting the Tabernacle until they came.
10.22: And the troop of the camp of Aphreim by their army picked up and the Prince of the host: Elishama son of Amihud.
10.23: And Prince of the army of the tribe of Menasheh: Gamaliel son of Partsur.
10.24: And Prince of the army of the tribe of Benyamin: Abidan son of Geduni.
10.25: And the troop of the camp of the sons of Dan picked up and all the camp and their army assembled, and the Prince of the army of the tribe of the sons of Dan: Akhiazar son of Amishaday.
10.26: And the Prince of the host of the tribe of Ashayr: Pagayl son of Akran.
10.27: And the Prince of the host of the tribe of Naphtali: Akhida son of Ainan.
10.28: These were the travels of the children of Israel for their hosts.
10.29: And Moshe said to Khubab, son of Rueil the Midianite, father in law of Moshe: “We are moving to the region of which LORD JEHOVAH said, ‘I shall give it to you’; come with us and we will do good to you because LORD JEHOVAH spoke good for Israel.’”
10.30: And he said to him “I shall not go, but I shall go to my land where I was born.”
10.31: Moshe said to him: “Do not leave us, because you know the place where we dwell that is in the wilderness and you have been eyes for us.
10.32: And if you go with us, what good it is that LORD JEHOVAH will do good for us, he will do good for you.”
10.33: And they moved from the mountain of LORD JEHOVAH a journey of three days, and the Ark of the Covenant of LORD JEHOVAH moved from before them a journey one day that it would prepare for them a dwelling place.
10.34: And the cloud of LORD JEHOVAH was over them by day whenever they moved from the camp.
10.35: And it was that when the Ark moved, Moshe said: “Arise LORD JEHOVAH, and your haters shall be defeated and we shall chase your enemies from before you.”
10.36: And when it rested he said, “Return, LORD JEHOVAH, unto the ten thousands and unto the thousands of Israel.”

11.1: And when the people were complaining, it was evil before LORD JEHOVAH, and LORD JEHOVAH heard and his wrath was provoked and kindled the fire of LORD JEHOVAH among them and consumed in the surroundings of the camp.
11.2: And the people cried out to Moshe and Moshe prayed before LORD JEHOVAH and the fire ceased.
11.3: And he called the name of that region “The Burning”, because the fire of LORD JEHOVAH burned among them.
11.4: And a mixed multitude that were among them lusted lust and returned; they caused weeping also for the children of Israel and they were saying, “Who will feed us meat?
11.5: We recall the fish that we were eating in Egypt without charge, and cucumbers and melons and leeks and onions and garlic.
11.6: And now, behold, our soul has wasted away and there is nothing but this Manna before our eyes.”
11.7: And manna was like the seed of coriander and its color like the color of pearl.
11.8: And the people were walking around and they gathered it and were grinding it at the mill or were beating it in a mortar and were boiling it in pots and they made cake from it and its taste was like the taste of dough with oil.
11.9: And whenever the dew descended on the camp in the night, Manna came down upon it.
11.10: And Moshe heard the people weeping among their families, each man in the door of his tent, and the wrath of LORD JEHOVAH was provoked, and it seemed evil also in the eyes of Moshe.
11.11: And Moshe said to LORD JEHOVAH: “My Lord, why have you done evil to your Servant and why have I not found mercy in your eyes, that you have laid upon me all the weight of this people?
11.12: Have I conceived all this people or have I given birth to it, that you say to me, ‘Take it up into your bosom like a nurse taking up an infant, to the land that I swore to their fathers?.’
11.13: From where do I have meat that I shall give to all this people that weep upon me and they say, ‘Give us flesh to eat?
11.14: I cannot endure all this people alone, because it is too hard for me.
11.15: If you do so to me, kill me please, if I have found mercy in your eyes, and I shall not see my misery.”
11.16: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “Gather to me seventy men from the Elders of Israel, those whom you know, those who are the Rulers of the people and its Scribes, and take them to the Time Tabernacle, and they will be prepared there with you.
11.17: And I shall come down and I shall speak with you there and I shall take away from the Spirit that is upon you and I shall put it upon them and they shall bear with you in the burden of this people and you shall not bear it alone.”
11.18: And Moshe said to the people: “Be hallowed tomorrow, for you shall eat meat, because you have wept before LORD JEHOVAH and you have said, ‘But Who will feed us meat, because that was good to us in Egypt’, and LORD JEHOVAH will give you meat that you may eat.
11.19: You shall not eat it one day nor two days, nor five days, neither ten days, neither twenty days.
11.20: For a month of days you shall eat it until it goes out of your noses and you shall have nausea, because you rejected LORD JEHOVAH Who is among you and you wept before LORD JEHOVAH and you said, ‘Why have we come out from Egypt?.’”
11.21: And Moshe said before LORD JEHOVAH: “The people among whom I am are six hundred thousand footmen, and you have said: ‘I shall give flesh to them and they shall eat a month of days.’
11.22: If sheep and oxen are slaughtered for them, what do they do for them? And if all of the fish of the sea are caught for them, how are they filled with them?”
11.23: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “The hand of LORD JEHOVAH is full; now you shall see if My word comes to pass or not.”
11.24: And Moshe went out and told the people the answer of LORD JEHOVAH and he gathered seventy men from the Elders of the people and he stood them around the Tabernacle.
11.25: And LORD JEHOVAH came down in the cloud and he spoke with him and took from the Spirit that was upon him and he gave to the seventy men, the Elders, and when the Spirit abode upon them they prophesied and they did not repeat.
11.26: And two men were left in the camp; the name of one, Eldad, and the name of the other, Midad, and the Spirit dwelt upon them, also those were written down and they did not come to the Tabernacle and they prophesied in the camp.
11.27: And a young man ran and he showed Moshe and said to him: “Eldad and Midad, behold they prophesy in the camp.”
11.28: And Husha Bar Nun the Servant of Moshe from his childhood answered and said to him: “My Lord Moshe, forbid them.”
11.29: Moshe said to him: “Do not be jealous for me; for who makes all the people of LORD JEHOVAH prophets? It is because LORD JEHOVAH puts his Spirit upon them.”
11.30: And Moshe entered the encampment, he and the Elders of Israel.
11.31: And the Spirit moved on from before LORD JEHOVAH and brought up quails from the sea and poured them on the camp a day’s journey here and a day’s journey there around the camp, and there were about two cubits on the face of the ground.
11.32: And the people arose all that day and all night and all day after it and they gathered the quails; the one that gathered ten cors had little, and they spread them out like a spread all around the camp.
11.33: The flesh was yet between their teeth and before it had passed through, the wrath of LORD JEHOVAH prevailed over the people and LORD JEHOVAH struck the people with a plague that was very great.
11.34: And he called the name of that country “The Tombs of Lust”, because there they performed a burial for the people who lusted lust.
11.35: And from Qabrey D'Regta “The Tombs of Lust”, the people moved to Khatseroth and they were in Khatseroth.

12.1: And Maryam and Ahron spoke with Moshe on the matter of an Ethiopian woman whom he took because he had taken an Ethiopian woman.
12.2: And they were saying, “Has LORD JEHOVAH spoken only with Moshe? Behold, he has spoken also with us”; and LORD JEHOVAH heard.
12.3: And the man Moshe was very humble, more so than all of the children of men upon Earth.
12.4: And LORD JEHOVAH said suddenly to Moshe and to Ahron and to Maryam: ‘Go out, you three, to the Time Tabernacle.’
12.5: And LORD JEHOVAH descended in a pillar of cloud and stood in the door of the Time Tabernacle, and he called Ahron and Maryam and they both went out.
12.6: And LORD JEHOVAH said to them: “Hear now my words; if your Prophecy will come, I LORD JEHOVAH am revealed in a vision upon you, and in a dream I speak with you.
12.7: My Servant Moshe has not been so, but he is faithful in all my house.
12.8: From mouth to mouth I am speaking with him in a vision and not in a likeness, and he saw the glory of LORD JEHOVAH; why were you not afraid to speak against my Servant Moshe?”
12.9: And the wrath of LORD JEHOVAH was provoked against them and he went out.
12.10: And the cloud left from the Tabernacle, and behold, Maryam was leprous like snow, and Ahron turned to Maryam and he saw that she was leprous.
12.11: And Ahron said to Moshe, “I beg of you, my Lord, do not account the sin against us for that foolishness we have done and for that sin we have done.
12.12: And do not let us be as a dead person who goes out from the belly of her mother and the body of her flesh is consumed!”
12.13: And Moshe cried out to LORD JEHOVAH and he said, “Help, O God! Heal her!”
12.14: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “If her father had spit in her face, it would have been fitting for her that she would be ashamed seven days; she shall dwell seven days outside of the camp and then she shall enter.”
12.15: And Maryam dwelt outside of the camp seven days, and the people did not pick up until Maryam entered.
12.16: And then the people picked up from Khatseroth and they camped in the wilderness of Paran.

13.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
13.2: “Send men; they shall explore the land of Canaan that I give to the children of Israel; every Leader that is among them, send one man from the tribe of his fathers.”
13.3: And Moshe sent them from the wilderness of Paran by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH; all of the men were Leaders of Israel.
13.4: And these are the names from the tribe of Rubil: Shamua son of Zakor.
13.5: From the tribe of Shemon: Shaphat son of Khadi.
13.6: From the tribe of Yehuda: Kalab son of Yuphana.
13.7: From the tribe of Issakar: Negayel son of Yoseph.
13.8: From the tribe of Aphreim: Husha son of Nun.
13.9: From the tribe of Benyamin: Palti son of Daphu.
13.10: From the tribe of Zebulon: Gaddiel son of Suri.
13.11: From the tribe of Yoseph of the tribe of Menasheh: Gaddi son of Susi.
13.12: From the tribe of Dan: Gamaliel son of Gamli.
13.13: From the tribe of Ashayr: Sethur son of Malkiel.
13.14: From the tribe of Naphtali: Nakhbi son of Waphsi.
13.15: From the tribe of Gad: Gwayel son of Makir.
13.16: These are the names of the men whom Moshe sent to spy the land, and Moshe called Husha, son of Nun, Yeshua.
13.17: And Moshe sent them to spy the land of Canaan and said to them: “Come up in this way to the south and go up the mountain:
13.18: And see the land, what it is, and the people dwelling in it, if it is strong or weak, or it is few or many.
13.19: And what the land is which they inhabit.
13.20: If it is fertile or trees are in it or not.” And they were strengthened and carried some fruit of the land, and the days were the days of first fruits of grapes.
13.21: And they went up and explored the land from the wilderness of Tsin and unto to Rekhob, which is in the entrance of Khamath.
13.22: And they came up to the south and they came unto Khebron and Akhiman; and Shishay and Tulmay, sons of the giants, were there, and Khebron was built seven years before Tsaan that is in Egypt.
13.23: And they came unto the valley of SegulaClusters and they cut from there a vine shoot and one cluster of grapes and they took it away on a pole between two and some pomegranates and some figs.
13.24: And they called that place the valley of SegulaClusters because of the clusters that sons of Israel had picked from there.
13.25: And they returned from the exploring of the land after forty days.
13.26: And they came to Moshe and to Ahron and to all of the assembly of the children of Israel to the wilderness of Paran, to Raqem, and they returned a report to him and to all of the assembly, and they showed them the fruit of the land.
13.27: And they related to him and they said: “We went on to the land where you sent us, and it flows milk and honey and these are its fruit.
13.28: However the people dwelling in the land is strong and the towns are fortified and very great, also we saw the sons of the giants there.
13.29: Amelik dwells in the land of the south and the Hittites and Yebusites and Amorites dwell in the mountains and Canaanites dwelt on the side of the sea and upon the side of the Jordan.”
13.30: And Kalab silenced the people in the name of Moshe and said: “Let us surely go up and possess it because we can prevail.”
13.31: And the men who went up with him were saying, “We cannot go up against the people because it is stronger than we.”
13.32: And those who spied out sent out the report of the land to the children of Israel and they said to them: “The land in which we passed through and spied out, the land consumes its inhabitants, and all the people whom we saw within it are men of stature.
13.33: And there we saw giants, sons of giants who are from the giants, and we were in their eyes like grasshoppers, thus we were in their eyes.”

14.1: And all of the assembly was in an uproar and lifted up their voice with weeping and the people wept that night.
14.2: And all of the children of Israel complained against Moshe and against Ahron, and the whole assembly said to them: “Oh, that we had died in the land of Egypt or in this wilderness! Oh that we were dead!
14.3: Why does LORD JEHOVAH bring us into this land that we shall fall by a sword, and our women and our little ones shall be prey? It was better for us when we were dwelling in Egypt!”
14.4: And they said, each man to his brother, “Come, we shall make a Leader for us and we shall return to Egypt!”
14.5: And Moshe and Ahron fell on their faces before all the crowds of the assembly of the children of Israel.
14.6: And Yeshua, son of Nun, and Kalab, son of Yuphana, of the spies of the land, tore their garments.
14.7: And they said to all of the assembly of the children Israel: “The land in which we went through to explore is very good land.
14.8: Truly, LORD JEHOVAH is pleased with us and brings us to this land and he gives to us this land that flows milk and honey.
14.9: Only do not rebel against LORD JEHOVAH and do not be afraid of the people of the land, because they are our bread, for their strength itself has passed away from them and LORD JEHOVAH is with us; you shall not be afraid of them.”
14.10: And all of the assembly said to stone them with stones, and the glory of LORD JEHOVAH was revealed in the cloud in the Time Tabernacle to the eyes of all the children of Israel.
14.11: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “How long do this people anger me, and how long do they not trust me in all the signs that I have done among them?
14.12: I shall strike them with a plague and I shall destroy them and I shall make you a people greater and mightier than they.”
14.13: And Moshe said to LORD JEHOVAH: “The Egyptians will hear that you brought up this people by your power from among them.
14.14: And the inhabitants of this land who heard that you are LORD JEHOVAH within this people will say that you LORD JEHOVAH are seen, eye to eye, and your cloud stands above them, and in a pillar of cloud you have gone out before them by day and in a pillar of fire by night.
14.15: And whenever you have killed this people as one man, the nations that have heard your name will say:
14.16: ‘Because LORD JEHOVAH was not able to bring in the people to the land that He swore to them, because of this, He slaughtered them in the wilderness.’
14.17: And now let your power be great LORD JEHOVAH, as you have spoken and you have said.
14.18: LORD JEHOVAH, your Spirit is patient and your kindness abundant, and you forgive evil and sin and you do not justify to justify; you order the lovedebts of the fathers on the children and upon the children of the children, upon three and upon four generations.
14.19: Forgive now the evil of this people according to the multitude of your favors, and as you have forgiven them from Egypt and unto now.”
14.20: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “I have forgiven them, according to your word.
14.21: However, I live, and all the earth is filled with the glory of LORD JEHOVAH.
14.22: And all the men who have seen my glory and the signs that I have done in Egypt and in the wilderness and have tested me, behold, ten times, and they have not listened to my voice.
14.23: They shall not see the land about which I have sworn to their fathers: ‘No one provoking me shall see it.’
14.24: And my Servant Kalab, for the sake of my Spirit Who has been with Him, and he has been fully after me, I shall bring him into the land that he entered there and his seed shall inherit it.
14.25: And the Amalekites and the Canaanites dwell in the mountains; tomorrow turn and move you to the wilderness to the way of the Sea of Reeds.”
14.26: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and with Ahron and said to them:
14.27: “How long is this evil assembly complaining before me? I have heard the complaining that the children of Israel were complaining before me.
14.28: Say to them: ‘I am living, says LORD JEHOVAH, but as you have said before me, so shall I do to you.
14.29: In this wilderness your corpses will fall and all your number and all your numbering from a son of twenty years and above, because you were complaining against me.
14.30: You shall not enter the land for which I raised my hands for you to dwell in, except only Kalab son of Yuphanah and Yeshua son of Nun.
14.31: And your little ones which you have said will be for prey, and your sons who have not known good and evil, today those shall enter the land and I shall bring them and they shall know the land which you rejected.
14.32: And your corpses, even yours, shall fall in this wilderness.
14.33: And your sons shall be Shepherds in this wilderness forty years and they shall bear your whoredom until your corpses are gone in this wilderness.
14.34: By the number of days that you spied out the land forty days, a day to a year, you shall receive your evil forty years, and you shall know that because you complained before me.
14.35: I LORD JEHOVAH, I have said that thus I shall do to all of this evil assembly that are assembled before me in this wilderness; they shall be consumed and there they shall die.”
14.36: And men whom Moshe sent to spy the land returned and they made all of the assembly complain against him because they sent out an evil report about the land;
14.37: And the men that put out the evil report about the land died in a sudden plague before LORD JEHOVAH.
14.38: And he saved Yeshua son of Nun and Kalab son of Yuphana from those men who went to spy the land.
14.39: And Moshe said these words to all the children of Israel and the people sat in great mourning.
14.40: And they arose early at dawn and came up to the top of the mountain, and they said, “Behold, we are going up to the country of which LORD JEHOVAH told us, because we have sinned.”
14.41: And Moshe said to them, “Why do you pass over the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH?” Because of this, do not go up to the top.
14.42: Do not go up, because LORD JEHOVAH is not with you, so that you will not be broken before your enemies.
14.43: Because the Canaanites and the Amalekites are there before you and you shall fall with the sword, for you have turned back from after LORD JEHOVAH and LORD JEHOVAH shall not be with you.”
14.44: And they began to go up to the top of the mountain and they did not withdraw the Ark of the Covenant of LORD JEHOVAH and Moshe from within the camp.
14.45: And the Amalekites and the Canaanites went down who lived in that mountain and attacked them with the sword and they chased them unto Kharma.

15.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
15.2: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them: ‘Whenever you have entered to the land of the place of your dwelling that I give to you as an inheritance.
15.3: Bring an offering to LORD JEHOVAH; a burnt offering or sacrifice, dedicate a vow or a dedication, or in your feasts, and make a fragrance of pleasure to LORD JEHOVAH from oxen or from sheep.
15.4: And he who brings his offering shall bring to LORD JEHOVAH a meal offering of fine flour, a tenth part mixed with a fourth of a hin of oil.
15.5: And wine for a drink offering: bring a fourth of a hin with a burnt offering or with a sacrifice of one lamb.
15.6: Or for one ram make an offering of fine flour: two tenths mixed with a third of a hin of oil.
15.7: And for a drink offering bring a third of a hin of wine, a fragrance of savor to LORD JEHOVAH.
15.8: And if you bring a son of a herd burning peace offering, or a sacrifice to dedicate a vow or peace to LORD JEHOVAH.
15.9: Bring with a son of a herd an offering of fine flour, three tenths mixed with half of a hin of oil.
15.10: And bring wine for a drink offering: an offering of half of a hin for a fragrance of pleasure to LORD JEHOVAH.
15.11: In this way do for one ox and one ram or a lamb of sheep or of goats.
15.12: According to the number that you do, in this way do each one by their number.
15.13: All of the house Israel shall do and shall offer an offering for a fragrance of savor to LORD JEHOVAH.
15.14: And if one who is converted to me will dwell with you or among you with your families and he will offer a gift of fragrance of savor to LORD JEHOVAH as you are doing, in this way he shall do.
15.15: There shall be one law for you and for him who is turned to me who dwells with you, the law to eternity for your generations; he who is converted to me shall be like you before LORD JEHOVAH.
15.16: There shall be one law and one judgment for you and for those who have turned to me who dwell with you.’”
15.17: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
15.18: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them, ‘Whenever you have entered the land where I am bringing you.
15.19: Whenever you eat from the bread of the land, dedicate an offering to LORD JEHOVAH.
15.20: Offer a cake from the best of your dough as an offering to LORD JEHOVAH, as an offering of the threshing floor; offer it in this way.
15.21: Give the best of your dough as an offering to LORD JEHOVAH for your generations.
15.22: And if you err and you will not do all of these commandments that LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe.
15.23: Everything LORD JEHOVAH commanded you by the hand of Moshe from the day when LORD JEHOVAH commanded and beyond for your generations.
15.24: And if the error was done before the eyes of the assembly, all of the assembly shall bring one bull, a son of a herd for a burnt offering, for a fragrance of savor to LORD JEHOVAH and its meal offering and its drink offering, according to its rule, and one kid of goats for sin.
15.25: And the Priest shall make atonement for all of the assembly of the children of Israel and it shall be forgiven to them, because it is an error, and they shall bring their offering a gift to LORD JEHOVAH, and that in the place of their sin, as an offering to LORD JEHOVAH for their fault.
15.26: And it shall be forgiven to all of the assembly of the children of Israel and to those who are converted to me who dwell in Israel, because it is the error of all the people.
15.27: And if one soul will sin by mistake, he shall bring a goat, a daughter of a year, in the place of sin.
15.28: And the Priest shall make atonement for the soul who has sinned in a sin of error before LORD JEHOVAH, and it shall be atoned for him and it shall be forgiven him.
15.29: And the children of Israel and those who are converted to me who dwell among you shall have one Law for the one who commits sin in error.
15.30: And the soul of you and of those who convert to me before LORD JEHOVAH who will commit sin by a high hand has blasphemed; that soul will be destroyed from his people.
15.31: Because he rejected the word of LORD JEHOVAH and he nullifies his commands, that soul will be destroyed and his evil will be upon him.
15.32: And the children of Israel were in the wilderness and they found one man when he gathered wood in the day of the Sabbath.
15.33: And those who found him brought him, when he gathered wood, to Moshe and to Ahron and to all of the assembly.
15.34: And they shut him in a guard house because it had not yet been explained what should be done to him.’”
15.35: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “The man to be killed will be killed; all of the assembly shall certainly stone him with stones outside of the camp.”
15.36: And all of the assembly cast him outside of the camp and they stoned him with stones and he died, as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe.”
15.37: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
15.38: “Speak with the children of Israel and tell them and they shall make for themselves fringes on the hem of their robes for their generations, and they shall make a ribbon of dark blue with the fringes of their hems.
15.39: And the fringes shall be for you that you shall see them and you shall be reminded of all of the commandments of LORD JEHOVAH your God and you shall do them and you shall not stray after your hearts and after your minds after which you were going astray.
15.40: And you shall remember and you shall do all of my commands and you shall be holy ones to your God.
15.41: I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God who have brought you out from the land of Egypt to be your God; I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God.”

16.1: And Qorakh son of Itshar, son of Qahath, son of Levi and Dothan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and Wawan son of Pelath, sons of Rubil separated.
16.2: And they stood before Moshe and men from the sons of Israel, two hundred and fifty Leaders of the assembly, being called for the time, men of fame.
16.3: And they assembled with Moshe and with Ahron and they said to them: “Is it not enough for you that all of the assembly are holy ones and LORD JEHOVAH is among them, but you will be lifted up above all of the assembly of LORD JEHOVAH?”
16.4: And Moshe heard and he fell on his face.
16.5: And he spoke with Qorakh and with all the assembly and said to them: “At dawn LORD JEHOVAH will show who is his and who is holy; he will be brought to Him, and whoever He has chosen for himself He will bring to Him.
16.6: Do thus: take for yourselves censers, you Qorakh, and all your assembly.
16.7: And put fire in them and put incense in them before LORD JEHOVAH tomorrow, and the man whom LORD JEHOVAH has chosen for himself he shall be holy; it is enough for you, sons of Levi.”
16.8: And Moshe said to Qorakh, “Hear again, sons of Levi:
16.9: Is it not enough to you that the God of Israel has separated you from all of the assembly of Israel and has brought you to him to work the service of the Tabernacle of LORD JEHOVAH and before the assembly to serve them?
16.10: And he has brought you, you and all your brethren, the sons of Levi with you, but do you seek also the Priesthood?
16.11: Because of this, you and all your assembly gather before LORD JEHOVAH tomorrow. And who is Ahron that you were murmuring against him?.’”
16.12: And Moshe sent to call Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab, and they said: “We are not going up.
16.13: Is it not enough for you that you brought us up from the land flowing milk and honey for our killing in the wilderness, but surely you are magnified over us also.
16.14: And you have not brought us into the land flowing milk and honey and you have not given us an inheritance of fields and of vineyards; if you put out our eyes we are not going up.”
16.15: And it was very evil to Moshe and he said to LORD JEHOVAH, “Do not be changed by their offerings, because I have not taken a donkey of one of them, neither have I done evil to one of them.”
16.16: And Moshe said to Qorakh: “You and all your crowd be before LORD JEHOVAH, you and those and Ahron tomorrow.
16.17: Each man take his censer and put fire in them and put incense in them and approach before LORD JEHOVAH, each man his censer, two hundred and fifty censers, and you and Ahron, each man his censer.”
16.18: And each man took his censer and they placed fire in them and they placed incense in them, and Moshe and Ahron stood before the Time Tabernacle.
16.19: And Qorakh and all the assembly gathered against them to the door of the Time Tent, and the glory of LORD JEHOVAH was revealed over the entire assembly.
16.20: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and with Ahron and said to them:
16.21: “Be separated from within this assembly and I shall destroy them in one moment.”
16.22: And they fell on their faces and they said: “Oh God, God of the spirits of all flesh, will one man sin and wrath will be on the entire assembly?”
16.23: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
16.24: “Speak with the entire assembly and say to them: ‘Separate from the surroundings of the Tabernacle of Qorakh and of Dathan and of Abiram.’”
16.25: And Moshe stood and went to Dathan and Abiram and the Elders of Israel went after him.
16.26: And he spoke with the whole assembly and he said to them: “Separate from the tents of these men who are sinners and you shall not touch anything that is theirs, that you will not be destroyed in their sins.”
16.27: And they withdrew from the tent of Qorakh and of Dathan and of Abiram, and Dathan and Abiram went out standing in the doorway of their tents, and their wives and their children and their little ones.
16.28: And Moshe said, “In this you shall know that LORD JEHOVAH has sent me to do all of these works and it was not from my mind:
16.29: If these will die according to the death of every person and a visitation will be visited upon them according to that upon every person, LORD JEHOVAH has not sent me.
16.30: And if LORD JEHOVAH will create a creation and Earth will open its mouth and swallow them, them and everything that they have, and those will descend and everything that they have alive to Sheol, you will know that these men have angered LORD JEHOVAH.”
16.31: And when Moshe had finished saying all of these words, the Earth was opened under them.
16.32: And the Earth opened its mouth and swallowed them, them and their households and all the children of men who were with Qorakh, and all their possessions.
16.33: And those went down, and everything that they had, alive to Sheol, and the Earth was covered over them and they were destroyed from within the assembly.
16.34: And all children of Israel who were around them fled from their voices and they were saying, “Lest the Earth will swallow us!”
16.35: And fire came out from before LORD JEHOVAH and consumed the two hundred and fifty men who were bringing incense.
16.36: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
16.37: “Say to Eliazer, son of Ahron the Priest, ‘Take the censers from among the burned up ones and cast fire there because they were made holy.
16.38: The censers of these sinners were among them and make them into thin plates covering the altar because they offered them before LORD JEHOVAH and they were hallowed and they shall be for a sign among the children of Israel.’”
16.39: And Eliazer the Priest took the censers of brass that those who were burned up had brought, and he beat them into thin plates for the altar.
16.40: A reminder to the children of Israel that a foreign man, whoever was not from the seed of Ahron, shall not be bringing to set incense of sweet spices before LORD JEHOVAH, and he shall not be as Qorakh or like all the assembly, as LORD JEHOVAH said by the agency of Moshe.
16.41: And all of the assembly of the children of Israel complained after that day against Moshe and against Ahron, and they said to them: “You murdered the people of LORD JEHOVAH.”
16.42: And when all of the assembly was gathered against Moshe and against Ahron, they turned to the Time Tent and they saw the covering cloud and the glory of LORD JEHOVAH was revealed.
16.43: And Moshe and Ahron came before the Time Tent.
16.44: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and with Ahron and said to them:
16.45: “Be separated from within this assembly and I shall destroy them in one moment”, and they fell on their faces.
16.46: And Moshe said to Ahron: “Take a censer and put fire in it and put incense in it and take quickly to the assembly and atone for them, because wrath has gone out from before LORD JEHOVAH; and the plague began suddenly among the people.
16.47: And Ahron did according to what Moshe said to him, and he ran within the camp and he saw that the plague began suddenly among the people and he applied incense and made atonement for the people.
16.48: And he stood between the dead and the living and the plague was stopped suddenly.
16.49: And there were fourteen thousand and seven hundred that died in the plague suddenly apart from who died in the dissension of Qorakh.
16.50: And Ahron returned to Moshe to the door of the Time Tabernacle and the plague suddenly was stopped.

17.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
17.2: “Speak with the children of Israel and take a rod from them, a rod for the house of the fathers from the presence of all their Princes, for the house of their fathers, twelve rods, and write a man’s name on his rod.
17.3: And write the Name of Ahron on the rod of Levi, because each tribe is for the house of their fathers.
17.4: And put them in the Time Tabernacle in front of the Testimony, there where I meet with you.
17.5: And it shall be that the rod of the man with whom I am pleased shall bud and I shall remove from me the complaining of the children of Israel, who are complaining against you.”
17.6: And Moshe told the children of Israel and all their Princes gave him a rod, a rod for a Ruler, twelve rods for all the house of their fathers, and the rod of Ahron was in the center of their rods.
17.7: And Moshe laid the rods in front of LORD JEHOVAH in the Tabernacle of the Testimony.
17.8: And the next day Moshe entered the Tabernacle of the Testimony and he saw that the rod of Ahron of the house of Levi budded, and it put out leaves and it produced almonds.
17.9: And Moshe brought out all the rods before LORD JEHOVAH to all of the children of Israel and they saw and each man took his rod.
17.10: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “Return the rod of Ahron before the Testimony to be kept for a sign to the rebellious children, that their complaining will cease from me and they will not die.”
17.11: And Moshe did as LORD JEHOVAH ordered him; thus he did.
17.12: And the children of Israel said to Moshe: “Behold, we are finished and we are destroyed and we all are ended.
17.13: And everyone who comes near to the Tabernacle of LORD JEHOVAH dies, and behold, we also have come out to die.”

18.1: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Ahron: “You and your sons and the house of your father with you, pick up the evil of the Holy Place and you and your sons with you, pick up the evil of your priesthood.
18.2: Also you shall bring your brethren, the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father with you, and they shall accompany you and they shall minister to you, and you and your sons with you are before the Tabernacle of the Testimony.
18.3: And they shall keep your guard and the guard of all the Tabernacle, however do not let them approach the holy garments and the articles of the altar, lest they and also you will die.
18.4: And they shall accompany you and they shall keep guard of the Time Tabernacle and of all the service of the Tabernacle and a foreigner shall not be brought with you.
18.5: And keep guard of the Holy and the guard of the altar and there will not be wrath again against the children of Israel.
18.6: And I, behold, I have brought your brothers the Levites from within the sons of Israel; they are given as a gift to LORD JEHOVAH to do the service of the Time Tabernacle.
18.7: And you and your sons with you keep your priesthood and all its apparel of the altar and do the work inside the face of the door, the gift I have given to your priesthood; and the foreigner who comes near shall be killed.”
18.8: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Ahron, “Behold, I have given charge of my offerings to you and all holy things of the children of Israel; to you I have given them with the anointing: it is the law for eternity for you and for your sons with you.
18.9: This shall be the Holy of Holiness for you from fire; all their offerings and all their meal offerings and all their sin offerings and all their offerings that they bring to me are Holy of Holies to you and to your sons.
18.10: In the Holy of Holies you shall eat it; every male shall eat it; it shall be holy to you.
18.11: And this is the dedication of your gifts and all dedications of the children of Israel; I have given them to you and to your sons and to your daughters with you, the law to eternity; everyone who is pure in your house shall eat it.
18.12: All the fat of the oil and all the fat of grain and of the wine and the first fruits that they are giving to LORD JEHOVAH, I have given them to you.
18.13: Every first fruit that is in their land that they bring to LORD JEHOVAH shall be yours, and everyone who is pure in your house shall eat.
18.14: And every devoted thing in Israel shall be yours.
18.15: And everything opening a womb of all flesh that they bring to LORD JEHOVAH, of man and of beast, it shall be yours; however you shall certainly redeem the firstborn of man and you shall redeem the firstborn of unclean beasts.
18.16: And the redemption of a son of a month and above you shall redeem with a price of money, fifty shekels in the shekel of Holiness; twenty mayn was a shekel.
18.17: However you shall not redeem the firstborn of an ox or the firstborn of lambs and the firstborn of goats, because they are holiness, and sprinkle their blood on the altar and offer up their fat as a gift on the altar for a fragrant savor to LORD JEHOVAH.
18.18: And their flesh shall be for you as the breast of the offering and shall be like the right shoulder for you.
18.19: Every dedication of holiness that the children of Israel dedicate to LORD JEHOVAH I have given to you and to your sons and to your daughters with you, the law to eternity; it is an eternal covenant of salt before LORD JEHOVAH, for you and for your seed with you.”
18.20: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Ahron: “You will not inherit in their land and you will not have a division among them, but your division and your inheritance is the gifts of LORD JEHOVAH and his holy things among the children of Israel.
18.21: And to the sons of Levi, behold, you have given all of them a tenth of the children of Israel for an inheritance in the place of the work of those working the work in the Time Tabernacle.
18.22: And the children of Israel shall not come near again to the Time Tabernacle lest they bear sin and they will die.
18.23: And the Levites shall serve the service of the Time Tabernacle and they shall bear their evil; it is the law forever for their generations and among the sons of Israel: they shall not inherit an inheritance.
18.24: Because the tithes that the children of Israel offer to LORD JEHOVAH I have given to the Levites as an inheritance; because of this I have said to them that among the children of Israel they shall not inherit an inheritance.”
18.25: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
18.26: “Speak with the Levites and say to them, ‘When you receive from the children of Israel a tenth, I have given to you an inheritance from them; separate from it an offering to LORD JEHOVAH, a tenth from the tenth.
18.27: And it shall be counted to you as your offering, as grain from the granary and like an offering from the winepress.
18.28: In this way you shall separate also an offering to LORD JEHOVAH from all of your tithes that you receive from the children of Israel and give an offering from them for LORD JEHOVAH to Ahron the Priest and to his children.
18.29: From all your gifts separate every offering to LORD JEHOVAH from all the best hallowed part of it.
18.30: And say to them: ‘When you separate the best of it, it shall be accounted to the Levites as crops of the granary and like crops of the wine press.
18.31: And eat it in every place where you and the men of your house are, because this is your reward in exchange for your work in the Time Tabernacle.
18.32: And you shall not receive sin for it when you offer the best part of it, and you shall not defile the holiness of the children of Israel, lest you die.’”

19.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and with Ahron and said to them:
19.2: “This is the commandment of the law that LORD JEHOVAH commanded and said, ‘Say to the children of Israel that they will bring to you a perfect blood red heifer without a defect on which a yoke has not fallen.
19.3: And give her to Eliazer the Priest; he shall take her outside of the camp. He shall slaughter her before him.
19.4: And Eliazer the Priest shall take from her blood on his finger and shall sprinkle from the blood against the front of the Time Tabernacle seven times.
19.5: And he shall burn the heifer before him; he will burn her skin and her blood and her flesh with her dung.
19.6: And the Priest shall take wood of cedar and hyssop and dye of scarlet and shall throw it within the burning of the heifer.
19.7: And the Priest shall wash his garments and shall bathe his flesh in water and then he shall enter to the encampment and the Priest will be defiled until evening.
19.8: And he who burns the heifer shall wash his garments and shall bathe his flesh in water and he will be defiled until evening.
19.9: And a man who is pure shall gather the ash of the heifer and he shall lay it outside of the camp in a place that is clean and it will be kept for all the assembly of the children of Israel to keep for the water of sprinkling, because it is of sin.
19.10: And he who gathered the ashes of the heifer shall wash his garments and he will be defiled until evening, and it will be the law to eternity for the children of Israel and those who convert to me who dwell among you.
19.11: And he who touches the dead body of any soul of man shall be defiled seven days.
19.12: And he shall sprinkle upon himself on the third day and on the seventh day and he shall be purified, and unless he shall sprinkle upon himself on the third day, he shall not be purified on the seventh day.
19.13: And all who will touch the dead of any person of man who will die and will not sprinkle upon himself, defiles the Tabernacle of LORD JEHOVAH; that soul shall be cut off from Israel because he did not sprinkle himself with the water of sprinkling; he shall be defiled again and his defilement is in him.
19.14: This is the law of a man when he should die in a tent: everyone who enters the tent and everyone who is in the tent such shall be defiled seven days.
19.15: And every vessel that was opened and was not covered is defiled.
19.16: And everyone who will touch one killed by the sword on the face of the field, or one dead, or the bone of a man, or a tomb, shall be defiled seven days.
19.17: And they shall take for him who is defiled from the dust of the burning of sin and they will cast living water on it over a vessel.
19.18: And a man that is pure shall take hyssop and he shall dip it in water and he shall sprinkle it on the tent and upon the vessels and upon every soul that was there and upon whom ever touched a bone, or one killed, or the dead, or a tomb.
19.19: The pure shall sprinkle on the defiled on the third day and on the seventh day and he shall sprinkle upon him in the seventh day and shall wash his garments and he shall bathe in water and he shall be cleansed in the evening.
19.20: And a man who will be defiled and will not be sprinkled upon himself, that soul will be cut off from within the assembly because he defiled the Holy Place of LORD JEHOVAH; the water of sprinkling was not sprinkled upon him; he is defiled.
19.21: And it will be the law for you to eternity and he who sprinkles the water of sprinkling washes his garments and whoever touches the water of sprinkling shall be defiled until evening.
19.22: And everything that he will touch shall be very defiled, and the person who will touch it shall be defiled until evening.’”

20.1: And the children of Israel came, the entire assembly to the wilderness of Tsin, in the first month, and the people stayed in Rakem, and Maryam died there and she was buried there.
20.2: And there was no water for the people to drink and the people assembled against Moshe and against Ahron.
20.3: And the people contended with Moshe and they said to him: “Oh that we had died in the plague of our brethren before LORD JEHOVAH!
20.4: Why have you brought the assembly of LORD JEHOVAH to this wilderness that we should die here, we and our animals?
20.5: And why have you brought us out from Egypt and you have brought us into this evil place, not a place to sow seed, neither of vines or figs or pomegranates, neither water to drink.”
20.6: And Moshe and Ahron came from before the assembly to the door of the Time Tabernacle and they fell upon their faces and the glory of LORD JEHOVAH was revealed upon them.
20.7: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
20.8: “Take for yourself the rod and assemble the assembly, you and Ahron your brother, and speak over the rock in their sight, and it shall give its water, and bring out water to them from the rock and give drink to the assembly and to their animals.”
20.9: And Moshe took the rod from before LORD JEHOVAH as He commanded him.
20.10: And Moshe gathered, and Ahron, the entire assembly to the rock and he said to them: “Hear now, rebels; from this rock we will bring water out to you.”
20.11: And Moshe lifted his hand and he struck the rock with his rod two times and many waters went out and all the people drank and their cattle.
20.12: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe and to Ahron: “Because you did not believe in me for my sanctification before the children of Israel, because of this you shall not bring in this assembly to the land which I have given to them.”
20.13: These are the waters d'Metsutha“Of contention”, for the children of Israel contended before LORD JEHOVAH and he was sanctified among them.
20.14: And Moshe sent Messengers from Raqem to the King of Adum: “Thus says your brother Israel: ‘You know all the trouble that has come upon us.
20.15: And our fathers went down to Egypt and we dwelt in Egypt for many days and the Egyptians did evil to us and to our fathers.
20.16: And we were praying before LORD JEHOVAH and he heard our voice and he sent an Angel and he brought us from Egypt, and behold, we are in Raqem, a town at the edge of your border.
20.17: Now we will pass through your land; we will not pass in a field or in a vineyard and we will not drink water of the wells, but let us go in the road of the King and we will not turn aside, not to the right neither to the left, until we pass by your border.’”
20.18: And Adum said to him: “You shall not pass through my border lest I come out to meet you with a sword.”
20.19: And the children of Israel said to him: “We will go up by the road, and if we will drink from your waters, we and our animals, we will give their price, only on our feet let us pass.”
20.20: And Adum said, “You shall not pass through”, and Adum came out to meet them with a strong people and with a mighty hand.
20.21: And Adum did not want to allow the children of Israel to pass through his border and Israel departed from him.
20.22: And they picked up from Raqem and the children of Israel, all of the assembly, came to Hor Mountain.
20.23: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe and to Ahron at Hor Mountain at the border of the land of Adum:
20.24: “Ahron shall be gathered to his people because he shall not enter the land that I have given to the children of Israel, because you provoked the Word of my mouth by the water of contention and you did not sanctify me by the water in their sight.
20.25: Take Ahron and Eliazar his son and bring them up to Hor Mountain.
20.26: And strip Ahron of his garments and put them on Eliazer his son and Ahron shall be gathered and he shall die there.”
20.27: And Moshe did as LORD JEHOVAH ordered him and they went up to Hor Mountain before the eyes of the whole assembly.
20.28: And Moshe stripped Ahron of his garments and he put them on Eliazer his son; and Ahron died there on Hor Mountain and Moshe and Eliazar came down from the mountain.
20.29: And all of the assembly saw that Ahron was dead, and all of the house of Israel wept for Ahron thirty days.

21.1: And the Canaanite King of Gadar who dwelt in the south heard that Israel came on the road of the spies and fought with Israel and he brought some of them captive into captivity.
21.2: And Israel vowed a vow to LORD JEHOVAH and said, “If you will hand over this people into my hands, I shall destroy their towns utterly.”
21.3: And LORD JEHOVAH listened to the voice of Israel and delivered the Canaanites into their hands and they killed them by the sword and utterly destroyed them and their towns, and they called the name of country that KharmaDestruction.
21.4: And they picked up from Hor Mountain in the way of the Sea of Reeds to its surrounding land of Adum, and the soul of the people was wearied in the road.
21.5: And the people complained against God and against Moshe and they said, “Why did you bring us out from Egypt that we should die in the wilderness, because there is no bread and no water and our soul is weary of the small bread?”
21.6: And LORD JEHOVAH sent destructive snakes against the people and they bit the people and many of the people of Israel died.
21.7: And the people came to Moshe and they said to him: “We have sinned, for we have complained against LORD JEHOVAH, also against you; pray before LORD JEHOVAH and he will remove the snakes from us.” And Moshe prayed for the people.
21.8: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “Make for yourself a destructive serpent of brass, and set it for a sign, and everyone whom a Serpent will bite shall look at it and he shall live.”
21.9: And Moshe made the serpent of brass and he set it for a sign and whenever a serpent would bite a man, he gazed at the serpent of brass and he lived.
21.10: And the children of Israel picked up and they camped in Aboth.
21.11: And they picked up from Aboth and camped at Ayna d'Ebraye “Spring of the Hebrews” in the wilderness that is next to Moab from the East, from the dawning of the sun.
21.12: And from there they picked up and camped in the valley of Zarad.
21.13: And from there they moved and camped at the crossing of Arnon in the wilderness that goes out from the border of the Amorites because the Arnon is Moab's border, between the Moabites and the Amorites.
21.14: Because of this, it is said in the book of the Wars of LORD JEHOVAH, “The Flame In the Whirlwind and In the River of Arnon.
21.15: And he has made ready the valleys that were inclining to the Habitat of Ad and were lying on the border of Moabites.”
21.16: And there is Bera, the well where LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “Gather the people to me and I shall give water to them.”
21.17: Then Israel sang this song: ’Spring up, oh well; answer it.’
21.18: The well that the Princes dug and the Rulers of the people dug up and they searched it with their scepters, and from the wilderness she inhabited Matne.
21.19: And from Matne to Nakhlayel and from Nakhlayel to Bemuth.
21.20: And from Bemuth of the valley that is in the country of Moab to the top of Ramtha that is seen against Ashimon.”
21.21: And Israel sent Messengers to Sihon the King of the Amorites and said to him:
21.22: “I will pass through your land and we will not turn aside in a field or in a vineyard and we will not drink from the water of your wells but we will go in the road of the King until we pass through your border.”
21.23: And Sihon did not allow Israel to pass over into his border and Sihon gathered all his army and went out to a meeting of Israel to the wilderness and he came to Yahaz and fought with Israel.
21.24: And Israel struck him with the mouth of the sword and they possessed his land from Arnon and unto Yabaq and unto to the children of Amon, because the border of the children of Amon was strong.
21.25: And Israel took all these towns and Israel settled in all the towns of the Amorites, in Kheshbon and in all its villages.
21.26: Because Kheshbon was the city of Sihon the King of the Amorites, and he fought with the King of Moab first and he took all his land from his border and unto Arnon.
21.27: Because of this, they were saying in a parable: “Enter Kheshbon, built and established the city of Sihon.
21.28: Because fire has proceeded from Kheshbon and a flame from the fortress city of Sihon and consumed Ad of Moab and the Servants of the high place of Arnon.
21.29: Woe to you Arnon! Woe to you Moab! You are destroyed, people of Khemosh! He gave his sons for hostages and his daughters into captivity to Sihon the King of the Amorites.
21.30: And the fields of Kheshbon are destroyed unto Ribon and they are laid waste unto Lankakh that is in the wilderness.”
21.31: And Israel settled in the land of the Amorites.
21.32: And Moshe sent to spy Yazar and conquered its villages and destroyed the Amorites there.
21.33: And they turned, they came up to the land of Mathnin and Og, the King of Mathnin, went out to meet them, he and all his people for battle in Arday.
21.34: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “Do not be afraid of him, because I am delivering him into your hands, and all his people, and all his land, and do to him as you have done to Sihon the King of the Amorites, who was dwelling in Kheshbon.”
21.35: And they put him to the sword, and his sons and all his people, and they did not leave a survivor and they inherited his land.

22.1: And the children of Israel picked up and they camped in the plains of Moab that are in the crossing of Jordan of Yerikho.
22.2: The Prophecy of Balaam: and Balaq son of Tsephor saw all that Israel did to the Amorites.
22.3: And the Moabites were very afraid before the people because they were very many, and it distressed the Moabites before the children of Israel.
22.4: And Moab said to the Elders of Midian: “Therefore this multitude are chewing up all who are around us as a bull chews up the grass of the field”; and Balaq was the son of Tsephor, the King of the Moabites at that time.
22.5: And he sent Messengers to Balaam son of Beor, an Interpreter upon the river, to the land of the children of Amon to call him and to say to him: “Behold, a people went out from Egypt and covers the face of the land and behold they camp against me.
22.6: Therefore come curse this people for me, because it is stronger than I; doubtless we can put some of it to the sword and we will destroy it from the land because I know that whomever you bless is blessed and whomever you curse is cursed.”
22.7: And the Elders of Moab and the Elders of Midian went and their divinations were in their hands and they came to Balaam and they told him the words of Balaq.
22.8: And he said to them, “Lodge here for the night and I shall give you an answer according to what LORD JEHOVAH says to me.” And the Princes of Moab stayed with Balaam.
22.9: And God came upon Balaam and said to him: “Who are these men with you?”
22.10: And Balaam said to God: “Balaq, son of Tsephor, the King of Moab; he sent for me and said to me.
22.11: ‘Behold a people went out from Egypt and cover the face of the land; now come curse it for me; doubtless I am able to fight with it and I shall destroy it.”
22.12: And God said to Balaam: “Do not go with them and do not curse the people, because it is blessed.”
22.13: And Balaam arose at dawn and said to the Princes of Balaam: “Go to your land, because LORD JEHOVAH does not want to let me go with you.”
22.14: And the Princes of Moab arose and they came to Balaq, and they were saying to him: “Balaam did not want to come with us.”
22.15: And Balaq returned again and he sent greater and more honorable Messengers than those.
22.16: And they came to Balaam and they said to him: “Thus says Balaq, son of Tsephor, ‘Do not refrain to come to me,
22.17: Because surely I shall honor you greatly and everything that you say to me I shall do, and come, curse for me this people.’”
22.18: And Balaam answered and said to the Servants of Balaq: “If Balaq will give to me his house full of silver or gold, I cannot pass over the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH my God, not for the small, neither for the great.
22.19: Therefore stay also here for the night and I shall know what LORD JEHOVAH continues to speak with me.”
22.20: And God came on Balaam in the night and said to him: “If these men came to call you, arise, go with them; only the response that I say to you, make that.”
22.21: And Balaam arose at dawn and mounted on his donkey and he went on with the Princes of Moab.
22.22: And the wrath of God was provoked against him because he went, and the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH stood in the road to be Satan an adversary to him, and he rode on his donkey and his two young men with him.
22.23: And the donkey saw the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH who was standing in the way and his sword drawn and held in his hand, and the donkey turned away from the way and went in the field, and Balaam struck the donkey for her turning out of the road.
22.24: And the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH stood in the path of the vineyard with a wall here and a wall there.
22.25: And the donkey saw the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH and she thrust into the wall and thrust the feet of Balaam into the wall and he continued to hit her.
22.26: And the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH went on and he passed by and stood in the narrow place where there was no way to turn, not to the right neither to the left.
22.27: And the donkey saw the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH and lay down under Balaam and provoked the wrath of Balaam and he hit the donkey with a rod.
22.28: And LORD JEHOVAH opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam: “What have I done to you that you have hit me now three times?”
22.29: And Balaam said to the donkey, “Because you have mocked me, and if there were a sword in my hands now, I would have killed you.”
22.30: And the donkey said to Balaam: “Was I not your donkey that you ride upon me from your youth and until today? Have I ever done to you in this way? He said to her, ‘No.’”
22.31: And LORD JEHOVAH uncovered the eyes of Balaam and he saw the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH standing in the way and his sword drawn and held in his hand, and bowing, he fell on his face.
22.32: And the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH said to him, “Why have you struck your she donkey now three times? Behold I have come out to be to you an adversary, because you have directed the way contrary to me.
22.33: And the she donkey saw me and turned aside from before me, behold, three times, and if she had not turned aside from before me, now I would have killed you and I would have let her live.
22.34: And Balaam said to the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH: “I have sinned; I did not know that you stood in front of me in the road. Now, if it is evil in your eyes, I shall return.”
22.35: And the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH said to Balaam: “Go with the men, only the word that I speak to you, do that”, and Balaam went on with the Princes of Balaq.
22.36: And Balaq heard that Balaam came, and he went out to meet him to a village of Moab that is on the border of Arnon on the edges of the border.
22.37: And Balaq said to Balaam: “Behold, I have sent for you to call you. Why did you not come to me? Perhaps you had said, that I am not able honor you?”
22.38: And Balaam said to Balaq, “Behold, I have come to you now, for surely I am not able to say anything but the word that God lays down in my mouth; that is what I say.”
22.39: And Balaam went on with Balaq and brought him to the city Khetsroth.
22.40: And Balaq slaughtered bulls and sheep and he sent to Balaam and to the Princes of his people.
22.41: And when it was dawn, Balaq led Balaam and took him up to the high place of Baala, and he saw from there the uttermost reaches of the people.

23.1: And Balaam said to Balaq: “Build for me here seven altars and prepare for me here seven bulls and seven rams.”
23.2: And Balaq did as Balaam said to him and Balaam and Balaq offered up bulls and rams on the altar.
23.3: And Balaam said to Balaq: “Arise, stand with your burnt offerings and I shall go; perhaps LORD JEHOVAH shall call to meet me and the answer that He shows to me I shall show it to you”; and he went straight forward.
23.4: And God was revealed to Balaam and said to him: “Seven altars you have prepared and you offered up bulls and rams on the altar.”
23.5: And LORD JEHOVAH put the word in the mouth of Balaam and said to him: “Go to Balaq and thus speak.”
23.6: And he came to him and he stood with his burnt offerings he and all the Princes of Moab.
23.7: And he lifted up his proverb and said: “From Aram, from the mountains of the East, Balaq, the King of the Moabites, has led me and said to me: ‘Come curse Yaquuv for me and come destroy Israel for me.’
23.8: How shall I curse him that has God not cursed, and how shall I destroy him whom LORD JEHOVAH has not destroyed?
23.9: Because from the top of the mountains I saw him, and from Ramtha, his limit; behold the people dwells alone and is not counted among the nations.
23.10: Who can count the troubles of Yaquuv and the number of the fourth of Israel? May my soul die the death of their upright ones and may my end be like them.”
23.11: And Balaq said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I called you to curse my enemies and behold, blessing, you bless them.”
23.12: And Balaam answered and said, “Behold, whatever LORD JEHOVAH puts in my mouth is what I observe to speak.”
23.13: And Balaq said to him: “Come with me to another region that you may see it from there, however its uttermost reaches you shall see and you shall not see all of it, and curse it for me from there.”
23.14: And he led him to a field of the Watchmen to the top of Ramtha, and he built seven altars and offered up bulls and rams on the altars.
23.15: And Balaam said to Balaq: “Arise here with your burnt offerings and I shall come as far as here.”
23.16: And LORD JEHOVAH was revealed to Balaam and put the word in his mouth and said to him: “Go to Balaq and thus say to him.”
23.17: And he came to him and he was standing with his burnt offerings and the Princes of Moab with him and said to Balaq what LORD JEHOVAH said.
23.18: And he lifted up his proverb and said, “Arise, Balaq and hear, and give ear to my testimony, son of Tsephor.
23.19: God is not a man that He would lie, neither a son of man to be advised; He says and he does and his word stands for eternities.
23.20: Behold I have been led to bless and I will not return the blessing.
23.21: I have not seen evil in Yaquuv and I have not beheld malice in Israel; LORD JEHOVAH his God is with him and the glory of his King is in him.
23.22: God has brought them forth from Egypt by his strength and with his majesty.
23.23: Because no divination is in Yaquuv neither an oracle in Israel, according to this time it will be said to Yaquuv and to Israel, ‘What God has done!.’
23.24: Behold the people rises up as a lion and like a lion lifts himself up; he will not sleep until he will eat the prey and the blood of the slain he will drink.”
23.25: And Balaq said to Balaam: “Surely do not curse him, neither surely bless him.”
23.26: And Balaam answered and said to Balaq, “Have I not said to you that everything that LORD JEHOVAH says to me is what I do?”
23.27: And Balaq said to Balaam: “Come, I shall bring you to another region; doubtless it will be pleasing in the eyes of God to curse him for me from there.”
23.28: And Balaq took Balaam to the top of Peor that appears opposite Ashimon.
23.29: And Balaam said to Balaq: “Build for me here seven altars and prepare for me here seven bulls and seven rams.”
23.30: And Balaq did as Balaam said to him, and he offered up bulls and rams on the altar.

24.1: And Balaam saw that it was pleasing in the eyes of LORD JEHOVAH for his blessing of Israel and he did not go as in every other time to know divination and set his face to the wilderness.
24.2: And Balaam lifted his eyes and he saw Israel encamped tribes by tribes, and there the Spirit of God was upon him.
24.3: And he lifted up his proverb and speaking, Balaam said, the son of Beor said, the man with his eyes open.
24.4: He who heard the speech of God and seeing the appearance of God said, when raising and opening his eyes.
24.5: “How beautiful your Tabernacle, Yaquuv, and your tents, Israel!
24.6: As the rivers flowing and like a gardenParadise beside the river and like the Tabernacle that LORD JEHOVAH planted and like the cedars by the waters.
24.7: A man will come forth from his sons and his seed, by many waters, and he will be exalted more than Agag the King, and his Kingdom will be exalted.
24.8: God has brought them forth from Egypt by his strength and with his majesty he will consume the nations of his haters, and their bones He will break and their loins he will cut off.
24.9: He crouched and lay like a lion and like the whelp of a lion, and who will raise him up? Those blessing you are blessed and those cursing you are cursed.”
24.10: And the passion of Balaq was angered against Balaam and he clapped his hands and Balaq said to Balaam: “I called you to curse my enemies and behold blessing you have blessed them, behold, three times.
24.11: Now go out, go you to your place; I have said that, honoring, I would honor you, and behold, LORD JEHOVAH has held you back from honor.”
24.12: And Balaam answered and said to Balaq: “Behold, I said also to your Messengers whom you sent to me.
24.13: That if Balaq gives to me a house of full of silver or gold I cannot pass over the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH and offer from my heart good or evil; anything that LORD JEHOVAH says to me, that I am speaking.
24.14: Now behold, I shall go myself to my land; but come, I shall advise you what this people does to your people in the end of days.”
24.15: And he lifted up his proverb and spoke saying, “Balaam, the son of Beor said, the man with his eyes open.
24.16: He said, hearing the speech of God and knowing the mind of the Highest, and he saw the appearance of God, when raising and opening his eyes:
24.17: “I saw him and not from now, and at the end and it is not near; the star shall shine from Yaquuv and the Prince shall arise from Israel, and he shall destroy the mighty men of Moab and he shall subject all the sons of Shayth.
24.18: And Adum shall be his inheritance and Seir the inheritance of his enemies will be his, and Israel will possess the power.
24.19: And he shall come down from Yaquuv and he will destroy him who is left from the city.”
24.20: And he saw Amaliq and he lifted up his proverb and said: “The Head of the nations, Amaliq, and his end will be destroyed for eternities.”
24.21: And he saw the Qainites and he lifted up his proverb and said: “Your habitat is strong and your nest is set on a cliff.
24.22: If Qain shall be for burning, unto Assyria they shall take you captive.”
24.23: And he lifted his proverb and said: “Woe! Who shall live when God puts these down?
24.24: And a legion shall proceed from the land of Khethites and they shall destroy Assyria and they shall destroy also the Hebrews; also those shall be destroyed for eternities.”
24.25: And Balaam stood and returning he went to his place also Balaq went his way.

25.1: And Israel dwelt in Settim and the people began to commit fornication with the daughters of Moab.
25.2: And they called the people to the altars of their gods and the people ate and they worshipped their gods.
25.3: And Israel was initiated to Baal Peor and the wrath of LORD JEHOVAH was provoked against the children of Israel.
25.4: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “Take all the Heads of the people and stretch them out before LORD JEHOVAH against the sun and turn back the heat of his wrath from the children of Israel.”
25.5: And Moshe said to the Judges of Israel: “Kill each man his men, those who are initiated to Baal Peor.”
25.6: And behold, a man from the children of Israel came and he approached before his brothers, and going in entered into a Midianite woman before the eyes of Moshe and before the eyes of all of the assembly of the children Israel, and they were weeping in the door of the Time Tabernacle.
25.7: And Phinekhas, son of Eliazar, son of Ahron the Priest, saw him and stood up from within the assembly and he took a spear in his hand.
25.8: And he went in after the man, a son of Israel, to the alcove, and he pierced them both through, the man, a son of Israel, and the woman, through her womb, in the alcove, and the plague was restrained suddenly from Israel.
25.9: And there were twenty and four thousand who died in the plague that came suddenly.
25.10: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
25.11: “Phinekhas, son of Eliazer, son of Ahron the Priest, turned my wrath from the children of Israel and he was zealous with my zeal among them, and I have not destroyed the children of Israel in my zeal.
25.12: Because of this, I have said: ‘Behold, I give to him a covenant of peace.’
25.13: And he shall have and his children after Him, a covenant of the priesthood to eternity, because he was zealous in his God and atoned for the children of Israel.”
25.14: And the name of the man, the son of Israel slain, who was killed with the Midianite woman was Zemri, son of Selu, a Prince among the fathers of the tribe of Shemon.
25.15: And the name of the Midianite woman, Cosbi daughter of Tsor; he was the Head of the people of the house of her fathers in Midian.
25.16: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
25.17: “Distress the Midianites and put them to the sword.
25.18: Because they distress you with their treachery by which they betrayed you in the matter of Peor and in the matter of Cosbi, daughter of the Prince of Midian, their sister who was killed in the days of the plague that came suddenly in the matter of Peor.”

26.1: And it was after the sudden plague that LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe and to Eliazar son of Ahron the Priest:
26.2: “Take a pebblecounting of all of the assembly of the children of Israel from a son of twenty years and above, for the house of their fathers, everyone who goes out in the army in Israel.”
26.3: And Moshe and Eliazar the Priest spoke with them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan of Yerikho.
26.4: And Moshe numbered them, from a son of twenty years and above, as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe and the children of Israel who went out from the land of Egypt.
26.5: Rubil, firstborn of Israel; the sons of Rubil: Khenok the family of Khenok: Pallu, family of Pallu.
26.6: Khetsron, the family of Khetsron: Karmi, the family of Karmi.
26.7: These are the families of Rubil and the number of them was forty and three thousand and seven hundred and thirty.
26.8: And the sons of Pallu: Eliab.
26.9: And the sons of Eliab: Nebuyel and Dathan and Abiram, prominent ones of the assembly that were divided against Moshe and against Ahron in the assembly of Qorakh, and they were divided against LORD JEHOVAH.
